review_body: This is a great hotel for business or leisure. The room is big and service is excellent. Hotel is next to Roppongi Hills shopping mall. Although there is a mall entrance to the hotel, it is a long walk and not so obvious. Subway is conveniently close to the hotel so it is easy to explore Tokyo. Price is not cheap but this is a good choice

The Grand Hyatt may be the perfect business hotel. It’s location allows access to the metro trains and you can get almost anywhere in Tokyo quickly as well as short walking distance to excellent restaurants and shopping. The hotel itself has some of the highest service standards anywhere and guests are always greeted with warm smiles and fantastic attitudes. Rooms are modern, well appointed and serviced to exacting standards. If you ever need something, just make a call to the front desk or room service and it’s delivered promptly. The pool, gym and locker room are first class. This may be the best Grand Hyatt in the world!

Staff in this hotel went out of their way to be accommodating and helpful, they were always friendly and although lots of changes going on due to the COVID-19 threat, they seemed to handle each change effortlessly and made all guests feel at ease. Highly recommend this hotel if you want 10/10 service, cleanliness, quality of service & great rooms

Staff were very helpful in arranging some package deliveries of masks, alchohol swabs, etc. and followed up diligently. Good reaction by the hotel as a whole to clean, reduce buffet meals, etc. to prevent any situations ahead of the governement encouragement

The Grand Hyatt is located in Mori Building, directly accessible for Hibiya and Oedo subway lines and the airport limo bus. The rooms are spacious, great amenities, and staff incredibly hospitable as expected for the class of hotel. My personal favorite is the luxurious bathroom, modern Japanese with a deep tub that fills so quickly (with bath salts!) and rainforest shower in the bath room, and separate high end Toto toilet. Super high pressure water.If you look enough ahead of time, rooms may be available at lower rates and even better value. Beds may be a little hard for some, though still some of the most comfortable and best night sleep of Japanese hotels.

Located right in Roppongi Hills, which is a local community for English speaking foreigners, this has great access to many Western facilities (i.e. Hard Rock Cafe, Shake Shack, premium Shopping Center) and many others. This hotel is top quality in everything, including the room; not just the lobby. And get ready to get spoiled with their premium bidets.

After living in this Tokyo neighborhood for 3 years, we moved to Shanghai, China. We had already planned to travel back for a visit during Chinese New Year, and with the emergence of Corona virus we extended for 3 weeks. What the Grand Hyatt doesn’t offer Is the epic Tokyo skyline views of some competitors, but it makes up in every other category. The immediate Roppongi Hills area has an amazing range of shops and restaurants. Breakfast at the hotel’s French Kitchen is amazing even after 3 weeks. The pool and gym are spotless and beautiful. Rooms are typical luxury hotel with plenty of space. And the staff is totally accommodating, they even opened the business center early so I could make overseas video conferences. The Grand Hyatt is Tokyo at it’s best.

This is definitely the most luxurious hotel in Tokyo. The staff of this hotel must be the best in the world. The managers are well trained. They care about their guests. From the check in to the check out process, the staff of this hotel takes care of small details. The restaurants and facilities are in great shape and well maintained. I will definitely chose this hotel as my first choice when in Tokyo.

Highly recommend this property to anyone traveling to Tokyo for business or pleasure. This was my first time staying in Roppongi. I found the hotel’s location and nearby restaurants to be easily accessible and plentiful. The hotel rooms are equipped with Handy mobile phones (pocket wifi) and Nespresso machines. The hotel staff is incredibly kind, patient and provided outstanding service during my stay. I accidentally booked duplicate rooms and the Front Desk Manager quickly corrected the situation and provided solutions. I even received a follow-up email, post departure, as the staff wanted to ensure I was satisfied. Tips:- Book a room with a view (Tokyo Tower)- Schedule time to visit the Club Lounge (superb items for breakfast and cocktail hour) - with the extra $Nearby: Sushi @ Sushi Zo or SushizanmaiDrinks @ Library Bar

This is our 8th stay at Grand Hyatt Tokyo within 3 years & we considered ourselves as their regular guest. We like the location as it’s close to a lot of the fine dining restaurants & their concierge team always look after our restaurant reservations. They have the best concierge team in Japan!Always appreciate their high tech Toto toilet seat & the soft water absorbing towel. Good news is they finally upgraded their room key access to the touch card entrance which quite a lot of 5 stars hotels has already been doing that. There are still areas of improvement especially guest services area though.

I was not a fan of the grand club food at all and normally I love the food at the grand club. The concierge people are clueless and horrible at giving direction of where to eat and what to do. I love the rooms and the front desk and the restaurants and the location.

One of my favorite hotels. Hotel staff are great and are extremely helpful and attentive. Amenities and location are fantastic. Easy walking distance to lots of interesting restaurants and easy walk to subways. Price seems to move up over the last year so be sure to plan in advance

We thoroughly enjoyed our four night stay at the Grand Hyatt! The hotel itself is tasteful and lovely, but it is the staff that really stood out. They were all so polite and helpful, especially the concierge staff who provided wonderful service. The hotel is located in a nice and peaceful neighborhood, which we greatly appreciated after spending our days in far more crowded parts of the city. We also loved the fitness center, pool and bath facilities — so relaxing! I highly recommend this hotel as your peaceful respite from the crowds and bright lights!

We have stayed at the Grand Hyatt multiple times, and it never disappoints. From the moment you step out of the taxi you feel like you are the most important guest. The location is fantastic and the rooms are well appointed. The spa has amazing facilities that one should not miss. This trip I had an unfortunate accident and broke my arm. Kano arranged getting me to the local hospital and Christiane made sure that I had everything I needed when I came back. She even arranged to get me some ice packs from a local store. Like I said service above and beyond, and we cannot thank them enough. I would highly recommend this hotel and we always look forward to coming to Tokyo and staying at the Grand Hyatt:).

I love the Grand Hyatt. On this occasion, I had a room on a high floor. When I arrived, it was a crystal clear day and the view over the city, including Mt Fuji was amazing. The rooms are decorated in a very modern fashion with wood and glass. The bathroom area is large with a rain-fall shower which is terrific, especially when you are jet-lagged.

Exciting to stay at this “see and be seen” hotel. While a tad dated the rooms are well appointed and include great linens. The view of Mt Fuji from the rooms was spectacular. Great selection of higher end restaurants and bars. Service was very good.

We stayed at Grand Hyatt Tokyo during cherry blossom season, and even though the hotel was very busy, the service was impeccable.The concierge helped us with so many things including sold out museum tickets, the room service food was just amazing. Even the cafe downstairs was able to accommodate us with some improv fresh ginger tea when I was sick.All the restaurants in the hotel are amazing as well, and the convenience of the location can’t beat either. Central but not too busy area, would recommend Grand Hyatt Tokyo to anyone!

I have stayed at this hotel many times. the hotel has not dated. An exceptional service standards. The staff is brilliant. The lounge particularly is fantastic. theres no need to go out in the cold. I look forward to my next stay.

The Grand Hyatt is the ideal value at the heart of Tokyo's Roppongi Hills. Shopping, dining and more all at your finger tips. The Christmas market the opens late November/early December brings additional holiday charm to the area. But first and foremost is the service service service! We are always pampered and coddled throughout our annual stays. The most relaxing two weeks of the year.

Pleasant experience with really cheerful and welcoming check in. Room was spacious and furnishings were up to date. Conveniently located in roppongi area and there were also quite a few convenient stores nearby to grab necessities if required

Excellent staff, great facility; assisted with making local dinner reservations. Would DEFINITELY recommend this hotel if you are staying in the Roppongi area. Everyone was extremely helpful during our stay!

Fantastic hotel!We had a short stay this time, was upgraded to an Executive Suite, beautiful!! Great big lounge with great service, great location so many restaurants around, great staff taking care of all our needs!!I will stay here again next year! Very Highly Recommended!!

Had a 2 night stay at this property. It is close to the Hibiya Line Roppongi Station and next to the Roppongi Hills. And that's about all the goods things about this property. Did not offer to upgrade room for once but that is understandable as it was during holiday season. Room was on the club floor on the 10th and during meal time it gets really crowded and noisy in the hallway and will negatively affect you if you want some quiet time in your room. Food selection was very limited even for a club. I would recommend anyone who is considering to stay at this property to go to the Hyatt Regency Tokyo as they are a more rational choice, better services for a less expensive rate.

We stayed during the end of 2019 and new year days. We had very nice experieince of the quality of hotel and high level of staff hospitality (OMOTENASHI). The restaurants were really high quality and serve excellent foods. The Grand Hyatt Tokyo is the hotel to stay.

Very good location. Right at Roppongi. Downstairs is a mall, lots of restaurant nearby, high end or low end you name it.Good customer service.They have a Tokyo tower view which is nice but it’s a partial view blocked by the commercial office building. The window would be looking at a bunch of hard working people working inside their high end office. People are very dressed up in this area probably due to the high end area. It’s a good people watching area. I have stayed here 3 times. Would recommend staying here if you value location more than view. For view go for park Hyatt.

Roppongi Hills is the perfect location for a Tokyo visit. The Grand Hyatt is attached to a lovely upscale mall with great food, entertainment and transportation options. The hotel offers a lovely breakfast & even has a jazz bar with live entertainment. The bar can be a little smoky though. The rooms are nice and service levels are what you would expect in a top Tokyo hotel. Prices only go up, so if you see a good rate, grab it!

Use the concierge staff — they are amazing! There is nothing they wine accommodate and also have excellent suggestions, Neighborhood is also great. Also worth upgrading to the Grand Club. Every restaurant is great. Everything about the hotel offers excellent value!

Great location as it’s right next to 3 subway stations and close to lots of very good restaurants in roppongi and azabu juban. Excellent service despite the busy time of year. Rooms were a little tight but the bed was massive which is most important.

Someone at Fiorentina Boutique keeps harassing my family by calling them repeatedly during really inappropriate hours. What happened was, after I handed them my credit card to purchase the chocolates, the staff mistakenly charged them to my room. When I asked front desk about this, they took it out because I had copy of a credit card receipt in hand. Someone even ran to the shop to verify and told me I was free to leave, and of course I rush to catch my flight. Grand Hyatt is not cheap. I paid nearly $1800 for 5 nights so I’m not trying to game the system over $50 box of chocolates to ruin my reputation or jeopardizing my chances of staying there again. They called my old cellphone on 12/20 and my mom picks up (Hyatt’s system does not push new numbers to all of their hotels and my mom uses my old number now). they call my mom a couple more times on 12/30, one of them at 1:51am local time. They know I don’t use that number but they are intentionally harassing my 64 year old mother over Christmas and New Years. I paid a couple thousand dollars to stay there and the hotel keeps harassing me. This should be illegal. Grand Hyatt Tokyo intentionally harassing family members of customers, and complete disrespect over two boxes of chocolates. I demand this particular individual to be reprimanded, and need to know what Hyatt has done to fix this issue from occurring again in the future.

Not the first time staying at Grand Hyatt. But this time proved to be a disappointment. Perhaps it was my stay at the Park Hyatt just 2 weeks ago (flawless, impeccable service. Despite ageing hardware) that has given this stay an even bigger contrast. Check-in - process was lengthy with plenty of questions and only after 15 minutes that we could fetch our keys. Didn't proactively offer extra bed despite us checking in with our 5/7 yo kids. (My friends who stay next door called for extra bed and suggested us do the same later on). Brunch at French Restaurant - appalled by the lack of food variety and quality. Concierge - didn't confirm our dinner booking on 25th Dec (xmas!) so we had to make another ad hoc booking through Mandarin Oriental's concierge where our other family were staying at. All in all, service and attentiveness is critical in upholding a hotel's brand and on this (xmas) occasion Grand Hyatt has failed to live up to (my expectation of) its own.

One of the best hotels in Tokyo for me. Very convenient location above Roppongi station and lots of Michelin restaurants around. Most importantly Staff provided exemplary service and I would definitely stay here again.

We were here for Christmas and had an amazing time. Ivan from the Oak bar was extremely friendly and helpful. Christmas dinner was beautiful and really gave us the Christmas feeling we were missing from Ireland.

Having worked for a company in the Mori Tower in previous years, and now coming to Tokyo twice a year, Roppongi Hills is always an easy place to be for an American. But the staff at the Grand Hyatt go out of their way to accommodate you, help with your transfers, luggage, reservations, etc. The rooms are quiet and the staff always eager to help you.

I travel for business to Tokyo often, so I have tried many of the hotels in the area. The Grand Hyatt in Roppongi is consistently an outstanding place to stay if you want to be in the middle of things in Tokyo. The service is top notch. The rooms are all good. There are many great restaurants in the neighborhood.

Nothing fell short of what you would expect from a 5-star hotel. The room, the service, the restaurants, the amenities, and everything else either met or exceeded our expectations. We enjoyed our stay.

Comfortable, great service and close to everything necessary. First time to Tokyo, great place to stay as a first timer explorer and getting to know the city and areas of Tokyo. I had a major time difference from home so needed a good place to sleep and be up at odd hours, plus the 24 hour room service food varieties was better than any hotel in U.S.

Well appointed hotel with every imaginable amenity. Staff is so personable and courteous I never wanted for anything. They preempted my every move. Restaurants, cafés, bars, Luxury spa. Everything was on point.

I always love staying in Grand Hyatt. Service is always good and the area is convenience. I can easily catch a bus to Shibuya or taking the train around. Now there's a Christmas market and can enjoy a glass of mulled wine during the cold weather. Nothing much to complaint about, just that the room is always full so advance booking is recommended.

The property is in a great location in Roponggi. Rooms are beautiful and staff is extremely helpful and friendly. I have stayed at this location over 25 times while in Tokyo - always consistent. Nice fitness center and great restaurant options

Grand at the Hyatt. Enjoyable stay for a short week. The restaurant choice is vast and of great quality. Service is also top level. The hotel needs a bit of an uplift and renovation. But overall a great hotel.

Had a great experience at this hotel. The staff is excellent. They are highly trained. The hotel is neat and clean. The restaurants are excellent. Can't be better. They also have great security at the hotel.

Always love my stay at GH Tokyo. Service is consistently excellent. Rooms and hotel are always very clean and smell nice. Lounge has an amazing view of the city...perfect place for breakfast, evening cocktails or doing a little afternoon work. Great variety of restaurants and bars. Can’t recommend another hotel more!

It was my 3rd time in tokyo with my first timer family (Mom and Sister). Most of the Hotels I checked in were so-so, but this time it was grand, the room is really big and spacious and as usual people in japan are really courteous and friendly and very accommodating. We had a great time walking around tokyo even though it rained on our 2nd day, still, we had fun. The Hotel was really neat and nice and the food was awesome.

This is my 10th stay at the Grand Hyatt Roppongi.The greatest asset of this property is the management and staff.Everything they do is efficient, professional and friendly.The level of hospitality sets a benchmark for others to follow.The only suggestion and I have mentioned this on several occasions is to improve the quality of their lattes offered at the French Kitchen.

We only stayed for one night after weekend getaway in Atami. Excellent location to explore Roppongi Hills area and surrounds. Places of interest, beautiful cates and shopping malls within walking distances. Most appreciate allocation of a high floor room with view of Mount Fuji for our stay. Convenient limo shuttle to Narita Airport which saves us driving time and hazzle to change in underground. We will sure stay again for our next visist.

When traveling for business, you need to know that your hotel will help you be successful. At the Grand Hyatt Tokyo, you can be assured that your room will be perfect, your meals will be delicious, and your every need will be taken care of. It's that simple.

Incredible hotel and service. Will make sure to stay here again on my next trip to Tokyo. Prime location in Roppongi. Rooms are spacious and modern. Fitness center and pool are top notch. Service level incredible!

wonderful hotel with a very accommodating staff, beautiful spa and the outstanding Oak Door restaurant and lounge. Great location to train access, shopping and abundant night life. Won't think twice about staying here again

Incredible service from arrival to departure, lovely pool and fitness centre. Excellent spa staff and treatment. Business centre staff especially Ms Kozuma so helpful and patient. Great location and yet very quiet

Stayed overnight at Grand Hyatt Tokyo due to a storm when all flights where cancelled due to typhoon last October 12. It is pricey, however their hotel is very very modern. Breakfast was ample. Service was great. Room had very beautiful view of Tokyo Tower. Rooms had all sorts of amenities. Toilet had a Toto wash that the lid opens up when you step in. Of course Toto toilets are all over Japan. But this one was a step up.

Terrific facilities, wonderful staff and a great atmosphere. This was my second stay within 6 weeks for the rugby world cup, both of which were wonderful experiences. The Oak Door bar was great fun, serving some of the best food in Tokyo.Loved every minute

The hotel sits out top/ attached to the mall. Really easy to get to using metro use exit 7. The staff super friendly and nice especially HAYASHI, she really remembered my details which gives you a personal positive feeling. The hotel spa is amazing, nice pool and hot tub, top of the line massage chairs with lockers and plenty of staff willing to assist. I have been to this hotel before but I definitely will be back. Super convenient for most things and very accommodating

Wonderful place to stay. We really enjoyed the club level - food and drinks were delicious. Staff was very helpful; the room was beautiful and the area of town is ideal. We especially liked the high end bidet that opened up when it sensed you in the room!

The highlight of my stay was definitely the impeccable service: check in staff to the bellhop. This hotel did an outstanding job with service. I can't recommend the concierge services enough: from knowing the neighborhoods in Tokyo, making reservations in a timely manner, speaking conversational English, and giving out clear and concise directions. The hotel is located right in the middle of Roppongi which is an expat neighborhood in the heart of Tokyo. The hotel connects to the mall and is within short walking distance to the Tokyo metro subway gray line and some great local restaurants. The location was definitely convenient to getting around to different areas in Tokyo. The common areas of the hotel are very well maintained and eye catching. I especially liked the gym/spa/pool area. While the pool isn't as flashy as some of the other hotels in Tokyo, it is still quite nice. The spa was also free to use and had amazing massage chairs in the rest area. I was slightly disappointed in the room but I can't blame the hotel for this. The hotel was completely full for the enthronement ceremony and the Rugby World Cup so they placed me on a low floor. There was no view whatsoever, but surprisingly the room was still pretty quiet even with the close proximity to the street. The room itself felt a little too 90s decor and probably could use a refresh. However, it was very clean, spacious, and well laid out. The breakfast at the hotel seemed a little hit or miss to me. I had decided to try the breakfast after reading the glowing reviews and I felt somewhat let down. I think for the price point the buffet breakfast should have had more variety offerings. The quality was top notch, but it just seemed like the spread was sparse for the price (I believe it was around $55 USD per head). I would probably eat outside of the hotel unless you are Diamond. One tip if you are coming from Narita or Haneda: the limo bus drops you off directly at the hotel. I thought this was super convenient instead of taking the NEX and then transferring to a taxi or subway. I would definitely consider staying at this property again.

Excellent location, Excellent staff. Well worth the value. Closely situated to local cafes, restaurants, shopping and subways.If you are flying in from Haneda the hotel is only 25-30min away, much better then the long travel time from Narita.

This hotel is perfectly located to maximize fun in Tokyo. The service is first class. The choice of bars and restaurants is impressive and the staff are always attentive. The jazz bar is worth a visit as is the steak house on the sixth floor. Breakfast is very good and provides a good buffet. The concierge service are knowledgeable and always there to assist. The pool is simply excellent and very well maintained. Great gym. The staff went above and beyond their duties during Typhoon Hagibis and stayed overnight in the ballroom to ensure service was uninterrupted. Overall a great week

This is truelly a Flagship Hyatt in a fun area. We were there over the Typhoon Hagibis and were aware of the fact that over 400 staff slept in the big function halls to ensure the guests stay was safe and memorable. Thankyou for this a we wish the Japanese strength and well over this period.

Love this hotel and it did I not dissapoint again. Great location, beautiful rooms. We hunkered down and battled out Super Typhoon Hagibis in comfort and safety at the Hyatt. The Oak Door bar and restaurant are great and we loved the Japanese Sauna and bath house.

The service and room is excellent. One of the best hotels in Rappongi Hills. I would stay here anytime. The French Kitchen has the best breakfast. My next meeting will be near Tokyo Station, so I won't be staying here on the next visit, but looking forward to a future meeting in Rappongi.

Cannot believe anyone would leave this establishment a one or two star review. The location is great and close to shopping and great restaurants (including Sukiyabashi Jiro Roppongi and Butagumi, the 2nd best sushi and the best tonkatsu I’ve ever eaten). In fact there is a mall literally connected to the hotel itself. Speaking of restaurants, I cannot speak highly enough of the concierge team. They helped me coordinate and reserve a plethora of restaurants months in advance—including both Sukiyabashi Jiro locations—and were incredibly helpful and responsive the entire stay. The rooms were clean and room service was always prompt and very thorough. Even though we didn’t use it, the hotel also provided a mobile phone in each room which was a nice touch. We sampled the breakfast buffet once and it was good with both western and Japanese options. But you are in Tokyo so go out and eat!! I had no complaints during or after my stay and I cannot recommend this hotel strongly enough. Yes it can be on the pricey side but you get what you pay for. And as many reviews stated this is the PERFECT base camp from which to explore and eat in Tokyo.

My mom and I stayed here for 4 nights. We are traveling to Japan, Taiwan, Singapore and Australia to celebrate my mom's 60th birthday. The check-in process was seamless. Our suite upgrades cleared right after reservation confirmed, unlike Marriott SNA. every staff at club lounge are helpful willing to answer questions for tourist. Great people here set a benchmark for Grand Hyatt. Thank you very much. I would come back for sure.Oh by the way, The LOUIS VUITTON city guide book in the room is insane!!

We were here for the best part of a week. The hotel is big but doesn't feel at all overwhelming; it's centrally situated in a great area of Tokyo and is connected to (yet another) luxury mall...it has everything you might need, the staff were excellent, the business club floor was really convenient if you have points.

Everything about our 2 night stay at this hotel was exceptional- the room was beautiful and so well designed, the staff was great, and the brunch was the best my wife and I have ever experience, in all our stays around the world.On top of everything else, the location of the hotel was great- near museums, a huge mall with lots of eating choices, and centrally located.Great.

This is my second time at the Grand Hyatt Tokyo and it has again blown expectations out of the water. The staff and service you get at this hotel is out of this world, every interaction with the staff is wonderful and they seem to really care about your every need. The club lounge staff is whom I had the most interaction with on a daily basis and they can not be praised enough. They are so attentive to every single detail and go above and beyond for whatever you need. The staff is the reason why this is my favorite hotel in the world and the reason why I will always keep coming back!

Best location and hotel to explore Roppongi area.It was nice experience to spent last night here. Staff fast response and helpfull. I was enjoyed evening cocktail at 10F Grand Club Lounge. I completed my experience at 6F Japanese resto with sushi menu for dinner. It was nice and hope to come back next year.

You pay for it but this is one of Tokyo’s gems. Good sized rooms and great bathrooms. Black our blinds!! Much needed after long flights. Love the oak room for pre dinner drinks and the breakfasts are up there with the best around

Awful service from the front desk. They reneged on a previous check in and reservation arrangement. Will never stay at this hotel orHyatt again!! I previously had talked to a front desk who helped me with a complicated checkIn . Now they said this isn’t valid anymore !

, Its a nice place but it can be better from design compared to other nice facilities in Tokyo but it the connection to the mall is great with good food options and the nice trendy area across the street.

This was actually my tenth stay here, for seven nights in September 2019, in room 902. The Grand Hyatt is superbly located in the lively Roppongi district, the hotel linked to the smart Roppongi Hills shopping complex and bang on top of a subway station that is just three stops away from the central Ginza district. It is useful to be able to walk directly into the shopping mall without leaving the air conditioning, and the complex also has a fine art gallery and plenty of restaurants and bars, in addition to those within the hotel.Rooms are very well designed, with lots of little details that elude many posh hotels. The beds are excellent, the duvets lovely, and the cascade shower is great. Drawers glide smoothly and the reading lights by the bed are on flexible stalks. There are plenty of electrical sockets, including some at desk level that accept most plugs, including UK three pin plugs. There is a large swimming pool and good gym on the fifth floor, and if you pay for a club room then you can access the club lounge on the tenth floor, which serves breakfast and evening snacks and cocktails, and soft drinks all day long. Even the club lounge champagne is Louis Roederer, a top quality non vintage champagne, rather than some generic fizz. The concierge team is the best in the city, with no less than fourteen concierges at your disposal. Staff are uniformly excellent, and even the lifts (elevators if you prefer) are slick. You rarely wait as much as ten seconds for a lift to arrive. Famous chef Alain Ducasse reckons this is the best city hotel on earth, and I would not argue with that assessment.

First, the location in Roppongi Hills, excellent.Next, the hotel itself, beautiful, modern, clean, luxurious.The Staff, none better. From check-in to check-out, they are fast, smart, gracious.The room, ours was large, luxurious, a gorgeous bath, comfy bed, light and bright, quiet, peaceful and calm. I'd love to live there.I travel often, love nice hotels, and this was one of my best experiences ever. If you are considering Tokyo hotels, this is one of the best values in Japan in my opinion. I hope to go back soon just to stay at this Grand Hyatt.

Welcoming and helpful staff. Hotel immaculate. Decor high quality. Room a good size. Housekeeping excellent. Bed very comfortable. Bathroom shower brilliant. Blackout blinds electric a very effective. Food stupidly expensive. It is very good quality though. Gym could do with modernising. I’m being a critic; probably overly so. For most people it’s good enough. But there is better kit out there now and this is below the standard of this hotel. The pool (didn’t use) looked beautiful. Go back for work? Certainly.

From the moment you make the reservation, the staff are at your service. The staff are very helpful, professional, respectful, polite... had the best facial at the spa. Beautiful room, abundance of facilities, activities, restaurants, and plenty of amenities. Wonderful stay. Will definitely return!

Stat in this hotel was excellent. Rooms were large. Pool and gym were good. Best part of the stay was the warmth of staff. They helped with early check out and airport transfers. Good hotel for business and family holiday.

Great customer service. The location is great as there is a lot to do in Roppongi and the metro is close by which gives easy and cheap access to all the tourist areas. There are a number of restaurants close by including many in the hotel with kid friendly options. We tried a couple and were very happy. Will stay again!

Beautiful hotel with super helpful staff and in a great location. The facilities including gym were also great, especially pool and the gym. Ate at a few of the restaurants too and all delicious. Will be back

The hotel and staff are first class. I enjoyed the Club King Room and access to the Club lounge enhanced our stay. Amazing breakfast and evening cocktails. Don't miss the spa and pool. They are one of a kind.

Once again the Grand Hyatt Roppongi, Tokyo has exceeded expectations. From registration through checkout the stay was flawless. Whether breakfast in the member lounge or room service with impeccable speed and politeness, the service and attitude were “ichibahn” as always. See you there next month.

Miki really went above and beyond to accommodate a group of 10, including late check out and adding welcome notes and gifts to make the stay special. The club breakfast was delicious every morning. Rooms were large and blackout shades divine for the jet lag.The spa, pool, hot tub, and massage chairs were amazing! I did share with the spa manager that I wish they would give the "Japanese" rules for the inner spa a bit more clearly (no clothes allowed) as I wasn't sure as a Westerner.

The rooms are huge. I was expecting smaller rooms in Japan but the rooms in Grand Hyatt are huge.It is located also in a very central location.The hotel is clean, the breakfast has a great spread and the service is excellent.

- Extremely hospitable towards non-Japanese guests.- Very clean and comfortable rooms.- Spa and fitness amenities were pretty great, need to check out the massage chairs!- So close to 2 Lawson's stores including a Natural Lawson which was pretty amazing.- A lot of restaurant options that are in the neighboring towers, so no need to go outside if the heat and humidity is brutal, which it was when I was visiting.Favorite Tokyo hotel so far.

Most recent visit confirms GH Roppongi Hills as one of my favorite city hotels anywhere. Decor, food, concierge, Grand Club staff - all are excellent, and consistently so over the decade plus I have been visiting.

Great hotel. Convenient location. Super nice concierge team.Rooms are efficiently designed. Decent view on the city. Very nice amenities (delicious cherry and bottle of wine)I loved the breakfast buffet. Incredible bread. Pool and gym are beautifully designed.

Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in Tokyo and wish it could have been longer! Great location for public transportation., taxis and overall good neighborhood, excellent service and well-appointed rooms. Will definitely be back!!!

the Location is convenient and excellent and it is a reliable location for a good service with good facilities and restaurants . Service is excellent and staff is always helpful. It is easy to get to other parts of Tokyo by Metro or taxi and there are more traditional steeet shops of Asabu Jyuban is nearby besides the Roppongi Hills compound which it is located. It is full of restaurants and shops and a museum

OK, it is expensive, but worth any Dollar you spend. Located perfectly to reach nearly any sightseeing spot you like, even by walking. Metro to any destination is located just around the corner. So you may spend more for the accommodations, but you spend less on taxi or any other fairs.Lot‘s of restaurants, bars, expensive, cheap and easy, casual all at walking distance. Equipped with all amenities you could enjoy a relaxing visit in this busy town.

I was here for business in offices attached to the hotel. It is unparalleled to be able to easily walk from the hotel to the office and back. The hotel is lovely with nice shops and restaurants. There are many dining options at different price points for If you are a car enthusiast, there is never a shortage of expensive, and rare cars in the parking area. It is a lovely place to stay in the Roppongi area - a high end experience. When we travel to Tokyo, we always prefer to stay here.

You cannot find a hotel with better service. The front desk staff and concierge staff treated us like royalty. Traveling to a foreign country can be difficut when you don't speak the language. They made it so much easier. The rooms were clean, comfortable and modern with high end tech. I was very impressed and would stay there again in a heartbeat. Special note: If you do go ask Atsuko Ichimura to help you at the concierge desk. She is amazing!

Super comfortable hotel. Great location and excellent service. I had booked two rooms and was able to add two rollaway beds for my family. Subway is just a 3 minute walk. No need to look elsewhere and just book this hotel. I had booked using my Hyatt points and definitely got my points worth for my money.

Treated with care from the moment I arrived. The pool, sauna, and hot/cold baths were very nice and recharged daily there. Diverse selection of high quality restaurants and bars. Very central location in Roppongi Hills.

Easy access to other parts of the city by subway and foot. Mall attached to the hotel gives plenty of food options without having to leave the property. Staff is friendly. Rooms are modern and clean. Only downside is the gym is super small and has the feeling of being inside a bunker.

We were stayed for 1 week at this end of June. We always experienced great stay at Grand Hyatt Singapore so we would like to try Grand Hyatt Tokyo this time.And we will never regret it at all. Before arrive there, we send the team regarding our late arrival and it is very well responded. The room was ready when we were arrived around 12 midnite and even the pocket wifi we ordered already placed well in the room. The twin room was spacious (specially in Tokyo) with 2 double bed, well equip and modern, yet the air conditioner was still too cool for us and the next day the portable heater has been sent to our room. The entrance of the room are dark when we turn off the master light and we provided with the standing lamp to solve the darkness. A very high standard of house keeping team (no noise at all, even when cleaning the room beside us), all the amenities well refilled, the room very clean, the bedsheet like new everyday (we request for two days changing), very smooth and clean. In one of the night around 12 AM, there was loud music noise from the room near to us like having party and we reported to the duty manager Mr Reo Kikuchi and it very well handle directly plus a very polite note in the morning for an apology. And the next day afternoon followed by the visit of Mr Masaaki Kitano special to met us also for apologies about the noise plus the cherry on the plate and 1 box of chocolate the next day.We truly amazed with all the staff politeness and sincere which make us highly appreciate and welcome.Definitely will stay here for our next trip without any doubt.But the buffet at French Kitchen need more international food and the dinning at Shunbou was great.The hotel link to Roppongi Hills mall, with all the branded shop and lots nice restaurant around just few step walk.The metro line Odeo (to Shinjuku) and Hibuya (to Ginza) just in 10 minutes walking distance.

I have stayed here twice. The rooms vary greatly in size. Staff is attentive and overall feels like a generic US hotel with slightly better (read: Japanese) service. Some rooms are much noisier than others so ask for a quiet room upon booking.

The hotels of the Grand Hyatt brand are usually the average level for its price, and most of the facilities are old, as far as my travel experience in many cities. But I think this is a new and good hotel. It can't be the same GrandHyatt as Grand Hyatt NYC. The location is wonderful and very convenient.Japanese restaurants are good, you can taste it at Rokuroku (Sushi) and Shunbou (Japanese casual cuisine), they are not the best, but more than average.Overall this is a very useful hotel for both sightseeing and business. The restaurants and cafes outside around this area is a bit noisy and crowded, so I would recommend the room with the lounge access.The hotel has a lot of overseas customers, so they know how to support foreign visitors.This point is valuable for visitors from overseas. On the contrary, one thing that disappointed me a lot is that staffs are a bit careless for Japanese customers indeed.

The room is very comfortable and the location is very near to the shops and activities in Roppongi. Very convenient. The Maduro bar is also a very nice place to have a drink and chill out. Staffs are very helpful and tentative.

Grand Hyatt Tokyo has everything you can ask for. In a city like Tokyo, where taxis are expensive, good location of the hotel becomes crucial. Hyatt gets 10 out of 5 on this front. It is 2mins walk away from Roppongi Tube station, Roppongi Party street, High street, Shibuya is nearby, Harajuku is nearby and so is Nishi Azabu (Gonpachi restaurant is here which is well-known as Kill Bill shooting location). You can go conveniently anywhere and everywhere from this spot.Rooms are very comfortable, washroom is good and wardrobe area is super functional. Special mention - the blanket! it was very soft & light. Felt like I a holding cloud. We had Grand Club access where we went for breakfast and evening snacks. It definitely added to our experience. Overall, I and my husband had a fantastic time at Grand Hyatt and we will again stay here in our next Japan visit. Highly Recommend!

One of my go to hotel when in japan, perfect location and professional staff. Will be booking again soon. Perfect for meeting clients and has lot of conveinient restaurants and shops near by, also a fan of the Grand Hyatt in Manila.

We are leaving today from here but in all the hotels we have stayed in I have never experienced this level of service .everyone goes out of there way to help in a place that could be different to navigate if you do not speak the language The rooms were comfortable bathroom was nice Spa is amazing!!!!Buffet also wonderful

We had recently traveled to Tokyo for tourism and found the Grand Hyatt to be exceptional in all facets. The property is gorgeous, the service impeccable though not intrusive and the location to be terrific. The room was relatively large and very comfortable. Roppongi Hills provided upscale shopping, entertainment and culture with close proximity to the "classic" Roppongi crazy nightlife. The very helpful concierge was helping us weeks before our stay You do not have to walk outside to easily use the train system. We would most definitely recommend this hotel and would most certainly stay here on our next trip.

If you’re visiting Tokyo and not proficient in the Japanese language, it is imperative to stay at a hotel with a resourceful concierge for restaurant bookings. Grand Hyatt Roppongi’s Concierge is efficient and clearly harbours good relationships with some of the best restaurants in Tokyo - Love this. The rooms are clean and comfortable. Lack a bit of natural light if you’re staying on a lower floor. Location is at Roppongi Hills, Lawsons convenient store across the road, plenty of shopping options and restaurants around the area. Most taxi drivers will know the location of the hotel - but I will still keep in hand the address written in Japanese. Well equipped and spacious (for Japan) gym and indoor pool.

It was a truly exceptional experience. I loved everything about this hotel. I would like to thank the night manager on duty for providing an excellent service and upgrade. The club lounge staff and food truly made our experience even that much more special. I will definitely come back to this hotel.

A regular at Park Hyatt Tokyo and Hyatt Centric Ginza. Recommended to try Grand Hyatt at Roponggi. BIG MISTAKE! Never had to wait until 3 pm to check in to a decent room. Had to insist on one for one and told to wait. First Impression last and GH TYO fail big time. Thanks for making it easy for me to divide my 70-80 nights annually in Tokyo.Not coming back to Grand Hyatt Tokyo thats for sure.(standing in the lobby with my laptop on my luggage to type this letter) Sad state indeed!

Our family has stayed here many times, twice a year recently during my wife's trip home. Grand Hyatt Tokyo is much more family friendly than when it first opened 15 years ago and we appreciate that. Wish the hotel pool hours were a little more generous for the little one.
Excellent hotel in great location.Highly recommended for business traveller or visitors to Japan.Grand Hyatt Tokyo is my first choice lodging for my business visits in Japan.Good value for the price.

Conveniently located next to Roppongi Hills shopping center and Mori Hills tower , the grand Hyatt has everything you need to satisfy either a business trip or a family vacation. If it is a very modern and elegant hotel, it does not show really major sign of local decoration. Neutral somehow but convenient and overall nice service.

Overall the hotel was great. Specifically, the service, concierge and room were wonderful. However, I was not impressed my the food offered via room service and the French Kitchen. Room device was awful and came up cold and looking not great. Breakfast buffet was uninspiring.

Grand Hyatt Tokyo was amazing, top to bottom - rooms super dark and quiet, located next to a great mall, amazing restaurants albeit quite expensive and the club lounge was phenomenal......top class service at every turn.......strongly recommended.

highly recommended but rates are very high. f&b is excellent. overall experience is one of the top service hotel in tokyo. must try the restaurants on the 6th floor as part of the hotel experience. must try this hotel!!!

The hotel is a most convenient part of town, the room is fully equipped right down to special kimonos which you may purchase, the bed is firm and comfy and the staff is super responsive and accommodating. I highly recommend Grand Hyatt in Tokyo.

Perfect business hotel in a great location, good selection of good choices, even a mall is attached for convenient shopping. Many fun places in walking distance from hotel. Will definitely come back to this hotel

The staff and accommodations we fantastic here. My only beef was I booked a king corner room with a view, and being on the 12th floor I only had a view of the neighboring building. Not exactly a prime experience for the money. Outside that everything else was perfect.

I am very satisfied with this hotel in terms of service, accommodation and food, just had a hard time shopping because the places we wanted to go to weren’t there, but it’s a short train trip and taxi away, so all is good. Friendly staff, clean rooms and good food.

The hotel is located in one of the best location in Tokyo, Roppongi Hills. This hotel defines what Grand Hyatt is all about... from exceptional front reception, concierge, bell captain, house keeping and "best" club room. Despite the fact that the hotel is located in a busy location, the room is very quiet and the bed is very comfortable and allows for deep sleep, great rainforest shower and good size bathtub to add. If you do not want to go outside (Roppongi Hills) to eat, then you must try sushi at Roku Roku or all-you-can-eat Dim Sum at Chinaroom restaurants. For breakfast, must try french toast at French Kitchen. BTW, you can walk to Roppongi Hills Cinema or subway stations without ever going outside. If you are visiting Tokyo for either business or leisure, you should definitely try this hotel.

I always stay at the Grand Hyatt when I am in Tokyo and I have done so for over a decade. This recent stay was as wonderful as ever. The comments in my last review are still totally valid. Our lunch at the China Room was particularly impressive. We miscalculated the time we had for lunch before leaving for the airport. They were extremely accommodating and let us in ten minutes before their opening time. The food was as exquisite as ever and we just wish we had had more time to do the meal full justice.

I disembarked early from a Crystal cruise in Tokyo, Japan and arrived at the Grand Hyatt Tokyo Hotel around 9 am. The check-in process was easy and quick. I requested an early check-in and asked for non-allergic (no feathers) room. The hotel accommodated our request and the room was ready by 9:30 am. The hotel staff and concierge were excellent. The rooms were clean and quiet. We definitely recommend the hotel.

Deserves its high rating, excellent reception, concierge and room service, large and luxuriously appointed rooms, lovely pool & fitness facilities, great view of Tokyo Tower from our room. Everything you would expect of a hotel in this price bracket.

My wife was not as excited as I was about visiting Japan so the compromise was we’d stay at a western hotel. The Hyatt in Roppongi was a great location lost to attractions and metro station. The hotel was beautiful and rooms were well appointed. Additionally, they offered “Handy” which is basically a cell phone that’s free to use and make calls from (international and domestic), make reservations,buy tickets and most importantly use maps. I thought this was a great feature for international travelers. The restaurants were pricey but also very good. Staff was incredibly friendly and attentive. Finally, for first timers to Japan the toilets were an experience all their own!

Grand Hyatt Tokyo is excellently located, great rooms, with a fantastic Club floor and amenities. Have recommended this hotel to several friends who have stayed there and feel the same way. Numerous options for dining and entertainment.

This hotel really is excellent. The place is spotless, very clean and very well kept. When you arrive the staff open the taxi door for you and are very helpful and friendly. We had 2 standard rooms which were very comfortable and clean. They give you smart phones in each room to use during your stay which is very handy so you don’t have to use your data. I loved the toilets in the rooms, they have heated seats and several different bidet settings with a dryer! The seat goes up by itself! Japanese toilets are the best! Anyway back to the hotel, I couldn’t fault it although it is a bit expensive but if you fancy a bit of luxury I’d recommend it.

From the “hosts” at the entrance to the front desk, housekeeping the Grand Hyatt wants you to always feel welcomed. Choice of Wall Street Journal or NYTimes delivered daily. The rooms are spacious with a spray/rain shower and large tub. The bed is fabulously comfortable. Great reading lights as well. Roppongi Hill’s shopping is next door. Midtown is 4 blocks and subway access is very close. The concierges were extremely valuable to plan which attractions to see, how long it would take, and, most importantly, how to use the very efficient subway system to get there. The breakfast buffet is very complete with omelette ordering and wonderful smoothies.The gym and spa are free if you are a Hyatt club member.  Many hotels in Tokyo, some more expensive, some less. In my opinion none could be more welcoming.

I am a very frequent traveler and this is one of my favorite hotels worldwide. The only thing better than the facility itself is the staff which are all fantastic. The location is very good and the hotel is world class. The staff provide a personal touch going above and beyond expectations. I consider this hotel my "home away from home".

I have been staying at this property since it opened The location is ideal for restaurants shops (Attached to Mall) Access to the subway and bus transport systems is within easy reach The staff are friendly and knowledgeable The French Kitchen serves one of the best buffet breakfasts

Really incredible levels of customer service throughout, attention to detail is impressive, great atmosphere amongst the team who are all totally focused on you, the customer, F&B and service levels in the Grand Club on the 10th floor better than most external restaurants, the Oak Door, Fiorentino and Keyakizaka are all great venues to host customer's, thank you GH Roppongi Team !

I’ve stayed here a couple of times while on business and it’s a stunning hotel situated in the Roppongi area, with several very good restaurants onsite. Finding them though can be a bit if an experience :). The rooms are large, very comfortable with a stunning bath and shower wet area. The staff are all very helpful, professional and help to make the stay very enjoyable. Breakfast is an awesome experience with direct access to the kitchen team who are happy to cater for your specific tastes. The range of options are extensive too!

We have stayed at the Grand Hyatt on a number of occasions and it is always been lovely. The hotel/food/service and gym are at the top of line. They bend over backwards to make certain your stay is outstanding. Highly recommend this hotel.

The stay was very comfortable. Facilities and services met high standards. Staff were very helpful and attentive. Room and bed were excellent and help ensure a good night sleep. Room was much more spacious than normally what I had experienced in Japan.

I have been at Grand Hyatt many time and I have I have never been disappointed. Attention to details, great customer service and great selection of food. It is within Roppongi Hills, at the center of it all
user_location: Long Island City, New York, United States

review_body: The hotel is located close to the Metro. The service was excellent at the club lounge - They went above and beyond to make sure we were comfortable. Our son is allergic to eggs and nuts and they made sure we got egg-less pancakes for him every day. The vegetarian food at Chinaroom was so good that we eat there twice. The Italian restaurant was really good too. The concierge desk helped us plan everything in detail and were very patient with all our questions. overall excellent hotel.

At Grand Hyatt Tokyo everything is conceived to make you stay at your best, and feel cared of a s a guest. All staff is attentive and truly caring, breakfast offers a large variety of food. Definitely recommended.

Grand hyatt Tokyo is one of the best hyatt properties in Asia Pacific.The people here are so nice and helpful.Grand club staff are great. Food served at the grand club is of very high quality.There are many fantastic restaurants in this hotel.Thanks so much to to Steve, Christiane, Tanaka-san and Ito-san for making our Sakura stay so wonderful.Will definitely stay here when I am back in Tokyo.Highly recommended!

Very close to the metro station and the spa is so worth trying! The staff are so nice and helpful and dinner was okay but breakfast wasn't that good. It is very clean comparing to other hotels are stayed in and room had a nice view.

Checked in 2 days ago and took over half an hour and I’m a Globalist member, can’t imagine for others ..Staff at entrances, Valet & Bell boy all friendly and helpful. Lady who check us in had nice attitude and manner, just the type of bed and room messed up which may not be her fault, she tried hard hitting on the system and walking in and out to the back office trying to help and too nervous to answer some of my questions, efficiency is the slowest for checking in and I even had to filled in my address and details which they have the record actually.I feedback to Reo the duty manager and he is so nice and solved out all problems straight away, thanks him for that and he is super friendly and polite, appreciated his concerns too.Just back to hotel at 9:30pm and tried to reserve a taxi to airport 4 days later, only one lady staff at front desk and she was on the phone. A boy staff asked us to wait politely at the concierge so we did, the lady finished her phone call and looked at us but ignored us (I’ve told the manager to check the CCTV for proof) so I asked her for help, she replied Concierge is closed and we have to walk outside to a counter for enquiry, IMPOLITELY !!I then asked why have the hotel guest to walk outside instead of sending a colleague in ? Come on ? Services ?! Grand Hyatt ? Or just a 3 star hotel standard ?!Then she said she can ask a staff to come in but not very polite also, then j asked for the duty manager to official complain her(don’t want to disclose her name here).My complain is the Front Office Manager did not train their staff well so 2 incidents happened and one worse than worse, despite I’m a Globalist Member since no greeting not welcome as a Globalist and zero World of Hyatt Globalist benefits except access to Club lounge and no amenities received at all but even I’m just a hotel guest I shouldn’t be treated this way.The unprofessional & rudeness of the staff is unacceptable, not as a 5 star hotel, not to a member of World of Hyatt no matter I’m a Globalist or not, not to a hotel guest who request services politely.Club floor staff were the best, you can see all the smiles and they are so friendly and super helpful, breakfast not variety enough and no egg station which most of the club lounges have in Tokyo but food and beverage cocktail is better than others. Housekeeping are good, very clean and tidy.But don’t think I will come back and whoever expecting services should not come to be disappointed ..

Super helpful service in one of the best hotel rooms I have stayed at. Everything was nice, clean and simple. The lighting in the room is amazing. They even give you a phone with data for use while you explore the city.

Amazing hotel!! We loved everything about the hotel and staff! The staff was so kind, accommodating, and pleasant. I could not be happier with the experience we had! Location was great. Food was amazing. Everything was wonderful!!

We have been to several restaurants of this hotel. Food was great but their restaurant staff needed to be more pleasant (which was really a surprise in Japan as most people in the service industry are extremely courteous).

This hotel is so nice! It’s located in a pretty central area. It’s a little quieter than Shinjuku, Shibuya, or Ginza. It is easy to access the subway to get to those places! The hotel accommodation is everything you’d imagine a luxury hotel to be, and more. The beds are comfortable, the bathroom is very luxurious, and the room is quiet.

Everything is great but need real and refrigerated milk in rooms for coffee, and softer pillows.Location is great and very central. The restaurants also have very good food and the French breakfast buffet is exceptional.

We had a high floor room with club access and it was absolutely the best Hyatt hotel we stayed at during our week in Japan. The room was spacious, the tub and shower were relaxing and grand. I took a bath every night after our whirlwind Tokyo sight seeing and shopping and it felt luxurious. The amenities that are standard in the room are perfect - from toothbrushes, cotton swabs and even a hair brush if you've forgotten yours. I heard that you can request a mattress topper as mostly all the beds in Japan are stiff and firm with basically no softness... it can take an hour to put it on so next time I will request this ahead of time as we didn't find out about this until our last day.The breakfast in the lounge was delicious and as vegetarians we had zero complaints. There were eggs, potatoes, cereals, yogurt, pastries, fresh fruit, coffee and juices that we loaded up on so we could enjoy our day.The hotel is located in a neighborhoody kind of area and we enjoyed walking to the Roppongi/Mori art museum and purchased some nice gifts at their store.The cafe downstairs had some lovely desserts we partook in after a long day of touring around.I'd stay here again in a heartbeat! It was truly a wonderful first stop in Japan.

Not having been to Tokyo for a long time, we settled on the Grand Hyatt for a week away without kids and loved the location and the hotel. We upgraded to a room with Club access, which was well worth it. The room was spacious, clean, modern and we had everything we required. The club was also great, with nice facilities and a good outlook from level 12, albeit, not a spectacular view. The hotel adjoins a nice shopping centre and public transport, but is also a reasonable walk to Yoyogi Park and the shopping of Shibuya.

My wife and I had a great 3 day stay at the Grand Hyatt Roppongi during our tour of Japan to view the cherry blossom time. I had stayed at this hotel many times on business in the past. Although not a Japanese style hotel, it is very nice place to stay. The staff is very accomodating, the rooms very Western and the food is very good. The location is perfect to enjoy the night life and great restaurants in the Roppongi area.

My wife and I stayed at the Grand Hyatt Tokyo for 7 nights in March 2019. This is a fantastic hotel. The rooms are well appointed and comfortable. Our view on the 19th floor was spectacular. And service throughout the hotel is top notch.The location is excellent. There is so much to see and do just within walking distance of the hotel. Roppongi station is a few steps outside the hotel complex and makes getting around Tokyo very easy. I loved this part of the city.We had a Grand Club room, which I highly recommend. I'm not sure if the room itself is different, but you get access to the Grand Club. The Grand Club serves a very good breakfast which I looked forward to every morning. The Club also offers "Cocktails and Canapes" from 5:30 to 7:30. This was a substantial spread of food, along with basic cocktails, wine, and beer. My wife and I planned our evenings to make sure we didn't miss this happy hour.The Grand Club also gives you free access to the spa, pool, and fitness center, which are all very nice. My only small complaint would be that I wish the fitness center was larger.Yes, you'll pay a lot of money to stay at the Grand Hyatt Tokyo but it's worth it. It's a fantastic hotel in a great part of the city. I highly recommend it.

So I'm writing this review after a few years later and still have fond memories. Before coming to Japan, I did my research of places I'd like to visit and this place came on top of my list as it was also in a film I've enjoyed watching (Lost In Translation).We came down on a weekend where there was a live band.We had a relaxing evening, loved the music and the bar menu (I had a delicious lobster roll). I remember also trying to order shots for us and the waiters going out of the way to help me choose ( Jagerbombs aren't something they are used to nor had unfortunately hahaha).We plan to come again to Japan and we will definitely come here again, maybe next year!...oh, and yes...the view is definitely something worth to come and see even if you're not planning to stay long!

There's nothing which I might suggest as an improvement area for this hotel. - Location: Best - high class locality, very close (infact connected through a mall) to the Roppongi metro station, connected to Toho cinema through a mall, connected to a mall obviously, good eating options right outside the hotel which provide you good authentic and slightly cheaper options to dine in. So, overall, great location.- Rooms: Good and spacious. After my Marriott Ginza experience, I was really expecting small rooms here also but even a standard deluxe room was good enough for a family of 3 to stay for 15 days, comfortably.- Service: high class and excellent. No complaints at all, about anything.- Reception: Very amicable staff who knows English.- In room dining options are not very expensive (They are... but at this hotel, i was expecting super expensive prices)- Special mention for the lounge and its staff. They are great. Very friendly people and very helpful. They are the ones who made our 15 days stay easier in Tokyo. Thanks a lot.Overall, a good stay. The only thing is... they are superrrrrrrrrrr pricey. So, at this rate, you expect all the good things which I've mentioned above.I'd love to stay here sometime again.

Stayed at the GH Tokyo again-- really a great location with superb staff and just really comfortable. Grand club was amazing again. Eri Tanaka-san and Erika Fox-san were all terrific-- along with their colleagues. Made sure I didn't miss my flight. Can't wait to come back. If you aren't going to use the grand club facilities-- at least try the automatica massage chairs-- spent hours just sitting there and getting a massage. Amazing!

Pros:This is a great location as it is near to train, subway, bus stations, and taxi's as well as upscale shopping, drug stores, convenience stores, restaurants, and some entertainment options. Everything is literally right downstairs or around the corner. The hotel is not right in the heart of Tokyo, so you will need to travel a little longer/further to get to many places, but you can get anywhere you want to go easily, and the location is not overrun with tourists all the time, which I loved. The rooms are huge and pristine. The hotel offers service in the morning and afternoon. They have all of the amenities you might need, and almost everything you might want. If you want anything they don't have, you can purchase nearby.I found the room rates to be very reasonable. I might have just been lucky, but they were fantastic for the room, amenities, and location.Cons:The water temperature fluctuated a lot, and the water pressure did as well.The costs for laundry and dry cleaning are astronomical (but there are a couple of coin laundry locations within a few blocks).Bottom Line:I would not hesitate to stay here again.

This was my first visit to the Grand Hyatt - previously I always stayed at its Sister property in Shinjuku, the Park Hyatt - which on this occasion was sold out.The arrival experience as impeccable with the front office manager accompanying me to my room.In the room fresh strawberries awaited along with chocolate covered almonds and a bottle of white wine.For cocktails I visited the lounge, which had a wide selection of food items as well as wines and champagne.I also tried the Japanese restaurant Roku Roku, which had a very good selection of sushi and sashimi.The club concierge helped me with a restaurant reservation at a famous steak house service only Kobe beef a week later, as I was headed to Niseko for skiing and was going to be staying at the Andaz upon my return to Tokyo - for the same reason - as the Park Hyatt was fully booked and so was the Grand Hyatt - presumably for cherry blossom.

We travel to Tokyo several times each year and since we found the Grand Hyatt we never stay anywhere else. Great location, wonderful service, spacious rooms. Stay on the executive floor and make regular use of the club lounge...it is fabulous!

Concierge is helpful and responsive in making reservations and suggestions for your time in Tokyo, rooms are modern and well appointed, housekeeping does an amazing job daily.. convenience store a minute walk away and with a direct connection to the mall.. couldn’t ask for more!

We stayed here Halloween 2017 and November 2018. We are Hyatt Globalists, and usually love Park Hyatts and Andaz. We loved the Grand Hyatt Melbourne in Australia, especially the lounge. So we tried this one: good value for the price. Lounge is excellent for evening hors d'oeuvres. We love the breakfast buffets and dinners at The French Kitchen downstairs (Pastry Chef Paschall is delightful at the buffet; and Araki great service at breakfast and dinner). Personal touches by Eri Tanaka so helpful before, during and after our stays. Over the top celebrations for our anniversaries. Megumi was very helpful in checking out and other arrangements. It is their warmth and service that have earned our loyalty.

Excellent experience. Staff was great with our kids, helpful with planning outings, and on top of restaurants. Great location, close to multiple subway lines. Pool and jacuzzi were beautiful - kids not allowed in main change rooms though. Buffet breakfast was one of the best we"ve had. Have stayed there many times and will definitely continue to do so.

Fantastic hotel, located in a great location in Roppongi district. Room was quiet and comfortable, with staff extremely welcoming. Highly recommend Club Room Lounge, one of the best. Would come again.

We’ve come to Tokyo many times over the past 16 years and always stay here. There’s no other place that’s like a second home for us and we’d never stay anywhere else but here. Masaaki Kitano who helms the front desk and Takashi Kai, who manages of the Grand Club Lounge, have always pampered us with their exemplary service. They’ve had different roles over the years but their attention to detail, immense job pride and personal kindness have shone through. They, like many of the staff, have become like family. They make us want to return year after year. The hotel may be 16 years old but it feels, smells and looks brand new. Our room and bathroom are always fresh and immaculate. Our stay would not be complete without the Grand club lounge and spa access. We so enjoy the wonderful food and staff at the club lounge. Kudos to the chef for always keeping the food choices fresh and delicious. Thank you to the staff, esp Kitano-San and Kai-San for making our recent stay superlative. You all make us long to return soon. We miss you and are planning our return trip already!

We stayed at the Grand Hyatt Tokyo (Roppongi) to treat ourselves on our tenth wedding anniversary. The buffet breakfast includes an international spread for most palates (and ages), we tried different things each day! Hotel bell staff / concierge / doormen offered to call a cab, take our bags, show us to the nearest ATM... each time we arrived back, or when we left the hotel in the morning. Location wise, we prefer Shimbashi, as it is better-connected (subway, JR trains). But creature comforts (space, amenities) more than made up for this. You can loan (or buy!) pyjamas - they are white cotton, and super comfortable. The king bed was a real King size (not common in Japan; 160-cm wide 'double' beds are more the norm here), and there was plenty of space for tech, toiletries, clothing, etc.

My second stay at the Grand Hyatt Tokyo. My second visit was for a family vacation. The hotel’s conseirge service is so dynamic, it can not be compared to anything else. We were given suggestions and recommendations based on what little information we had on the city and were provided with adventures so incredible they could not have been discovered by searching the web. Acknowledgements to Megumi Y. and Erika F. The team at the Grand Hyatt is PERFECT! Origato!

Great service and very attentive staffs. There were staffs literally every corner of the hotel. Also great location if you like Roppongi and Azabujuban area. The room is a bit outdated but very well maintained.

In the heart of Tokyo, this is an upscale hotel with attention to detail. Meiji Jingu Shinto Shrine is about 45 min walk and is great for a morning walk. The room has a minibar and a very unique toilet design that allows you to shower your behind and dry it using a control panel next to the toilet. The shower is particularly lovely and I enjoyed it because of the elegance of its design.

Grand Hyatt was a very good base for a busy week in Tokyo. It's location next to a mall and many restaurants was practical. It's also within a walking distance from some sights and Roppongi subway station.My room was very nice and clean. The bed was comfortable and there was a good chair for reading. The only thing about furnishing I didn't like was that there was no place for coat and umbrella etc. near the entrance.Their breakfast buffet is of excellent quality and good choice of Japanese and European/American type of food.In the lobby they had some guidebooks for guests, and the reception staff were very helpful.

Best Grand Hyatt in Asia by far. Customer service in lobby and executive lounge were excellent. Food at the lounge got the best presentation and tastes good. Love the breakfast and cocktail hour. Room was clean and comfortable. Location was convenient. Only wish we could stay a few more days...

Room well equipped for workingNice place also to restBed is excellentView on Mt Fuji in the morning by clear sky blablablablablablablablablablablablablablabla (thiis is to reach 200 character minimum, stupid, when we have nothing more to write)

Overall it was a great experience. Standard of service was excellent save for some selective attention on club floor. Concierge and bell service was above and beyond. Steak and Teppanyaki restaurants were good but a little costly and not quite value for money. Great location.

Have stayed many times for business. Rooms are small, but Tokyo rooms generally are. That said, they are very well designed. Great bathroom, especially the "shower room." Bed, linens, towels, all good. Am usually on a lower floor (business travel) so not much in the way of views. Great bar (the Oak Bar) and 3 great restaurants right there (shabu shabu, sushi, steak) -- all expensive, but again Tokyo is expensive city.

All staff spoke English and were very helpful if I had any questions, needed directions or a taxi. The room is well laid out and loved the blackout curtains. I unfortunately didn't have time to check out the restaurants or facilities on this trip. Hotel is very well located for anyone working in the Roppongi area.

Service is always top notch and convenience of location is hard to match. There are few hotels that can match the quality and friendliness of your staff. The array of restaurants at hotel and nearby is amazing. Access to Tokyo metro is quite easy which allows for quick commutes to business and shopping locations. I wish all my business trips could be in your city and your hotel.

Excellent Property & Excellent Service. Good choices of Reataurant within the Hotel. Helpful and knowledgeable staff makes it easy. Good location with easy access to local transportation. Would stay here again.

I stayed for one night in this beautiful mid-town property to attend an exhibition in Tokyo. From the moment you step into the hotel you can feel the high service quality of every aspect you are about to experience. The warm staff service, the well-maintained facilities as well as the high end surroundings.I had a room on the 20th floor which allowed me to face the Tokyo tower directly. It was memorable. During my stay I also tried the Japanese and Steak restaurant and I love the food and the service.The only thing I would say that could have been improved is the size of the gym. It was rather small for a 5-star hotel like Grand Hyatt. But all in all, this is one of my favourite properties in Tokyo.

the spa area was the best! Breakfast is also excellent and with lots of options. The cafe on the first floor is nice and food seems to be delicious - nice presentation.Bed and bathroom are nice and clean, with good sleep quality because of blackout curtainsThe only down point was the size of the fitness center - not big or fancy, but enough if you arrive early.

I don’t usually order room service breakfast but I’m certainly glad I gave this one a try. Everything was so fresh and tasty. And, being Japan, it was delivered right on time. It was all so good. I’m converted!

Can’t fault my stay, even the standard room is amazing and they were so sweet to go out of their way to wish us a happy anniversary. They also had a list of items you can borrow if you forgotten including hair straightens and yoga mat which you may not have brought in luggage and it was so helpful. I’m just so impressed, not all 5* are like this!

Grand Hyatt has a nicely designed pool but unlike other five star hotels which have very strict usage policy, it has none. We swam next to people who swam in their t shirts and no swimming caps. And there was small rubbish in the pool. The room is comfortable but there are obvious worn out parts that need touch up.

Stay there for business travel. The location was so great that I can go to office without leave the building! The facilities was wonderful, especially the gym / pool and changing room. Only one thing - front desk didn't really recognize the hyatt explorist status, neither any possible welcome gift or upgrades.

I landed by the red eye and though my room was not expected before afternoon, the staff was exceptionally nice and got a room ready for me at 7 am, and also upgraded me from a twin room to a king room

Very high quality hotel, great location within Tokyo and with a direct access to Mori tower offices. Impeccable service. The high quality is not only cosmetic, but also truly functional: e.g. a mobile phone was provided for the duration of the stay, with free commications and roaming.

There are many fine hotels in Tokyo, this is one of them. The service in all domains was impeccable. The concierge was first rate, the best I have encountered (and I travel a lot).The rooms clean, well designed, contemporary and good sized. Excellent gym facility which opens early.

Excellent location, More good restaurants in walking distance than you will ever be able to visit. Real highlights: the pool, the breakfast, the best laid out bathroom. Service was professional, polite and friendly.

One of my fav hotels of all time, visit on Sunday for brunch it is increadible. Always good quality beds, we had the view of Mt Fuji during our stay. The staff is friendly and helpful as well.We will def stay again

We celebrated my husband's birthday with a two-and-a-half week tour of central Japan, ending with 5 days in Tokyo. We couldn't have asked for a better time at the Grand Hyatt. The service is impeccable; got us a reservation to Jiro's! The location is fantastic; almost everything was an easy metro ride away. And the rooms are wonderful; we even had a view of Mount Fuji in recognition of my husband's birthday. It was the most perfect way to end our time in Japan. I can't wait to go back.

The Grand Hyatt Rappongi is consistently a great hotel to stay in. If you can get into the Club floor, for a business visit, it makes all the difference as you get a quiet space to work or have some good relaxation after a long day of meetings. The staff are always super helpful and very kind. I do love my stays here.

Business hotel, next to a convention centre and a luxury shopping mall (with several dining options available there). Professional and courteous service.Standard rooms are a bit small but well appointed. Excellent buffet breakfast. I would recommend this property but I would book a bigger room, even for two travellers. Good night of sleep as the rooms appear to be well soundproofed.

I had an overnight stay at Grand Hyatt Tokyo. It was my first time there and in Roppongi. It’s a beautiful, well situated hotel, with great Japanese service and high quality rooms. It’s very much a business hotel. The guests are all suits and it was a very frenetic breakfast experience.The room was fine, but very uninspiring. It’s just functional. The bed wasn’t not comfortable, too firm, the pillows were not fluffy. I had terrible sleep and based on this alone, I’d likely not stay again.I booked using American Express Fine Hotels and Resorts and was not offered the upgrade or breakfast benefit. It was disappointing.Lastly, food and beverage was good, but not very memorable.
