I had dinner at Roku Roku and the sushi nigiri pieces were small and I have had higher quality elsewhere in Tokyo.The Park Hyatt Tokyo or Andaz Tokyo are much better options in Tokyo if you’re looking for a Hyatt property.

This is one of the high end hotels in Tokyo. I stay in hotels in Tokyo 5 months a year on average. This time was the first to stay Grand Hyatt. Except for the amazing pool, everything else was just average. When I asked to set up a corporate account, they refused flat although my company is a global company and spend a lot on travels.

This is as high a quality hotel as you can find - service, room quality and the spa facilities are all absolutely superb. There is a wide choice of restaurants and the quality of food is very high. Despite its size and the fact it is incredibly busy, the service is still excellent. The gym/pool/spa is the best I have ever experienced in this kind of hotel. It caters for everything. You have to pay for all that though and it is expensive, especially the restautants. It would benefit from a cafe or bar that provides a more simple lunch or dinner option rather than all of the high end dining options.

Stayed 2 nights with my parents on a visit to Tokyo. The hotel has a great location as it is part of the Roppongi hills complex. The hotel is within 5-10 minutes walk from Roppongi Station (Tokyo Metro - Hibiya Line or Toei Subway - Oedo Line)The rooms are well appointed, very modern, comfortable and clean. The most amazing facet of the room apart from the fancy, futuristic toilets that Japan is known for, was the Handy device in the room. As international travellers with sometimes no access to a phone and wi-fi, this hand phone with pre-loaded internet was fantastic. It was amazing to go sightseeing and have the device on you to search restaurants, closest subway stations and opening hours for tourist spots on the go.The lobby is spacious and can be accessed from both outside and internally from Roppongi Hills complex.The service at the hotel in general is friendly and efficient.Don't forget to take a walk along Roppongi Hills to look at and take pictures of all the art installations and furniture artwork around the hotel.

The Hotel forms part of about 15 years old Roppongi Hills complex. It is an excellent example of Hyatt wold chain to its standards (except the gym was too small). Located on the intersection of Hibiya, Oedo, Nambobu and Chiyoda Subway Lines which give easy access to any part of Tokyo.We had to prepay our stay with extra charges at check-in. The additional charges were refunded on the check-out. But that was a bit odd. Why we couldn't settle the whole stay in one clean transaction?

This is a true world-class experience. I have stayed a total of roughly 20 nights here and had nothing less than an excellent experience. The attention to detail and amenities for guests is second to none. Heading back for another trip in two months.

Great hotel ... great F & B ... excellent facility (except for the gym) ... good service. Can't go wrong with this Grand Hyatt.Steak restaurant is lousy though. Canadian meat, really? We heard from other family member that the Japanese tepanyaki was excellent but did not have a chance to try.

We stayed here 5 nights recently. Modern clean rooms; great fitness center; nice spa area and pool; helpful concierge; great location near Metro. My only complaint is that while the breakfast buffet is large and high quality, there are very few Japanese items. We're in Japan after all. Why does breakfast seem like it's for Westerners? Obviously most guests are Western but still, we're visiting Japan for a reason! Overall highly recommended and I would stay again.

This was our second stay at the Grand Hyatt in Roppongi Hills. We love this hotel and it met our very high expectations. It has all of the qualities of a very high end hotel with A+ service. Our new favorite perk of this hotel: the wifi phone available for traveling around Tokyo. For those of you who ponder what to do over the lack of free wifi in Tokyo (and those that hate paying $10/day for international data access), this phone was super helpful for navigating around the city, finding restaurants and sights, and for keeping in touch with other members of our family. It erases all information at the end of your stay (or whenever you schedule for the phone to be erased and reset back to standard settings). You can download WhatsApp and communicate with others using this new free phone. This saved us at least $50 in our few days in Tokyo, since we were able to use these instead of buying SIM cards and replacing them in our phone. We have also ordered wifi spot devices and had them delivered to our hotels/AirBnBs while traveling, but this phone from Grand Hyatt worked very well.The other really nice amenities of this hotel: the nearness to both the Hibiya and the Oedo lines for subway travel, the nearly inside the hotel Starbucks (and the ATM next door to it), the fitness area hot and cold plunge pools inside the ladies lounge, the amazing restaurants inside this hotel on the 6th floor.

The amenities in the room were first class. First off they include a smartphone for complimentary use during your stay, which is really handy when one of your friends is too lazy to get a plan but gets lost easily. I also love having the Bluetooth speakers in the room. I'm a huge bathroom person, and the bathroom definitely exceeded my expectations. I took many blissful instagram-worthy baths. The bed was so big my friend and I didn't even realize we were both awake at the same time until we saw each other typing on Instagram. The pool was mildly uncomfortable, just because of the stiffness of it all. they were very polite but it seemed to be a mighty big deal to go for a dip. Not mention there are only about 5 or 6 chairs to lie on and there were no windows. The breakfast was very good - it was the best coconut water I've ever had. Every morning I would stuff myself with muffins because I had to try all the pastries. We also went to the jazz lounge and couldn't have been happier with the choice. The live music and cocktails were great- wish I'd brought a cigar too after seeing everyone puffing away.

This hotel worked well for us with two teenage boys. Comfortable rooms and beds and central location near a lot. The subway is right there to reach everything and the mall has food options and Starbucks. The breakfast is great but expensive. Roppongi has a lot to offer for restaurants and bars. Some areas are a bit seedy but easy to avoid. The hotel was very good about helping with reservations for dinner although I think they relied on the restaurants next door too much for our taste as we like to explore. We would stay there again.

I stayed at this hotel for a 2 week business trip in November. The hotel, staff, rooms and amenities exceeded all expectations. The customer service went above and beyond from all staff members. The hotel is nicely appointed with great restaurants, a gym, spa and attached mall. The rooms were very nice and a good size and the shower in the bathroom was phenomenal with a spa like quality. While the gym was small for the size of the hotel, it had all the necessary equipment and I never had a problem getting a treadmill or equipment. The pool and hot tub were very nice and the spa with relaxing massage chairs was always the perfect end to a long day. The are numerous amenities and great restaurants outside the hotel in close proximity. I look forward to a return trip to this hotel when I am in Tokyo again.

We have just checked out of the hotel and I’d like to thank the GH Tokyo team for a week of great hospitality. My family and I had a fabulous week in Tokyo and we were extremely well looked after - all of our requests were met with obliging and cheerful affirmations, and our arrival and departure were smooth as silk. My compliments to the team at the Grand Club who were always patient with our very active children and saw to our every need. The neighbourhood can't be beat - we had top-notch dining, shopping and culture right by our doorstep, though occasionally we also had room service in our beautiful and cosy suite and enjoyed every single morsel of the delicious gourmet offering.It's no wonder that the world's VVIPs make this their home when they visit the city and I intend to once again make the GH Tokyo my primary hotel whenever I visit.

High quality experience as expected. Room exceeds expectations in Tokyo with rain shower to recover from trip. Workout facility is smallish but never had issue getting treadmill. Weight area requires some contortion to get weights and lift. Bring goggles for huge pool and multiple soaking tubs. Many restaurants and one of the best jazz clubs for late night conversation with fellow travelers.

I stayed at this hotel many times as a business traveler and came back with my family while on vacation. Love the rooms and the gym/pool is divine. The concierge and staff overall are extremely helpful and accommodating. We had a very comfortable room, the hotel itself has lots of offerings, and the location is very walkable to many things - plus right next to key subways to take you everywhere you need to go. It is expensive, but worth the splurge. The only issue we had was not being able to take our toddler to the pool, which was annoying since no one else was in the pool at all. But the staff quickly tried to find a solution for us since we were very frustrated, having chosen this hotel partly for that amazing pool! All in all a great stay and I would return.

It is my first time to Japan and Tokyo. I choose Grand Hyatt mostly because there is a luminous bus from the Narita Airport to the hotel directly. I choose Roppongi because I want to visit those Art Museum and the sculpture Maman, which I visited 10 years ago in Canada National Art Museum. Generally speaking, the experience is great.Great place: near Roppongi subway station, Mori Art Museum and Roppongi HillsGreat room: Bed is comfortableGreat service: Staff is helpful and is willing to assist my needs.Great food: Food in Keyakizaka Teppanyaki is the great compared with those I could be found in Macao or Hong Kong.Some bad points:The path to the bar Maduro is not that trivial and I have to ask the staff to figure it out.The worst thing is the small clock next to the bed. It disturbs my sleep. I have to put in the drawer to have a good sleep.

Great Location, highly caring staff (esp. the lobby team) and comfortable room. Very good airport transfer, business service and check-out service. Would recommend it to business travelers and group of friends.

Just spent 5 nights. First class service, great location and wonderful rooms. Club lounge is very nice (great breakfast and relaxing place for a drink in the evening). While Japan is known for great service, the staff at the Grand Hyatt is simply the best!

Upon check out, I forgot to ask if the parcel has arrived which I was expecting to get during my stay. On the next day, Front Desk:Junichi and Mai contacted me by email to ask how they can follow up with. Long story to short, they sent it to me by courier and I was able to take it to my home. Thank you so much, Junichi and Mai!

ProsStaff- Everyone at the hotel was so nice and courteous whenever they saw me, from checking in with the nice young lady who helped me with all my questions about the Tokyo to exchanging my currency to starting a conversation about how half of her family is from South Carolina. Everyone is there to make you feel at home Room- I was upgraded to a 1 bedroom grand suite and it was huge with big windows all around of views of Tokyo. Location- right in the middle of the Beverly Hills of Tokyo, and directly attached to a huge mall..nightlife and bars are also within a few seconds walkConsOnly negative was that I should of stayed longer! Already planning my next trip to Tokyo and this Grand Hyatt

I'm a picky hotel snob, and this was a great stay. Service, rooms, location top notch. Hotel is beautiful and has everything you need. Will stay at this property for future trips to Tokyo, and will recommend for friends.

If you plan to visit Tokyo and would like an easy access to everything that’s good, stay at The Grand Hyatt! The best view of Tokyo Tower, various restaurants, cafes, boutiques, and shops within your reach and friendly staffs. I can assure you that your stay in the city will be a memorable one.

While not an easy hotel to find, it is worth the effort. I arrived by car from Narita; not sure how accessible it is from the train station, or by the airport bus. From check in to check out, the service was seamless, and uniformly top class. My room contained everything I would expect in a top notch property, and the king size bed was very comfortable. Great wireless connectivity. Public areas are spotless, and English is well spoken and understood.

I’ve stayed here several times over the years. The rooms, facilities, restaurants and ambience are all solid business 4.5 star. But the differentiator is the service. The best concierge I have ever dealt with - literally set them a task and it’s done - authentically committed to the customer and doing what it takes. Restaurants, speciality stores, my sons toy request - done. In this age where service is either begrudging, minimal or syrupy, it’s a wonder to behold.

This was my first time staying at the grand hyatt in Tokyo and it was a very pleasant experience. The hotel is very nice and clean and the staff were very nice and friendly. The location is nice as well and has many stores and shops right with in walking distance. The Subway entrance is also within walking distance too. It was a very enjoyable stay and since it was getting close to Christmas time there were many holiday decorations and Christmas trees up in the lobby and other areas. I look forward to staying here again.

Great business hotel. Though it was used for a vacation. Only drawback is it is a long walk to the subway station. This makes that hotel logistically hard for vacation travelers.Swimming pool as fabulous as is the gym facilities. Executive lounge gets eight stars.

The Grand Hyatt is a western style hotel perfect to begin our three-week excursion to Japan. It is located in the Roppongi Hills complex which has many restaurants subway access and an overall good location to explore Tokyo. The room was large by Japanese standards and the furnishings were getting old. It had a terrific swimming pool and spa complex. The separate male and female traditional hot tubs were very refreshing after a long day of sightseeing. It is a bit priceyWhat made this hotel really shine was the staff. In particular, one of the concierge staff, Miho Furusato, helped me plan each day's excursions and dinners. We went into detail with maps and transportation guidance. She made a large complex city easy to handle. The rest of the staff were always there to lend a hand.We loved our stay.

The Grand Hyatt Tokyo is one of our favourite hotels. The rooms are comfortable and well appointed. The beds and bedding are particularly comfortable and a good night’s sleep is assured by the incredibly effective black out blinds. The restaurants in the hotel are all truly excellent. We have noticed that many locals dine there regularly. The Oak Door steak house is one of our favorites. The Japanese A5 wagyu is one the reasons we keep going back. The bar has great atmosphere and is the perfect spot for either a pre or after dinner drink. The sushi restaurant and coffee shop are also highly recommended.If one visits during the cherry blossom season, there is an street opposite the hotel that offers one of the best cherry blossom walks in Tokyo.However the real highlight of any stay at the Grand Hyatt Tokyo is the incredible service and truly personal attention given by the team.

I have been staying here approx 4 times a year for the past 16 years. Still the best grand Hyatt in the world I have stayed in. Rooms are small but well laid out, good service and beautiful ambiance. Location is central enough for me.

As I said PERFECT... this means no room for improvement.The location of this hotel is just perfect as this is located in the city centre.The hotel staff is way too helpful, right from front office staff, to the restaurant staff or even the housekeeping boys, they will listen to you and will to help you every manner...!!!The rooms are also very nice, the placement and designing of the rooms is done in such a way that they will suit the leisure or the corporate traveler.

There is not one single thing I could fault in the Grand Hyatt Tokyo. The staff are the best I have ever come across on many trips overseas. The restaurants & food are so good we choose to stay in The hotel often. The terrace is an excellent place to people watch & enjoy the food & drinks. Overall it is no 1 my favourite hotel worldwide.

Stayed here for 4 nights on a business trip. The service is good. The rooms are spacious and well appointed. The toilets are well designed. The breakfast spread is decent and had variety. Location is very good.

I stayed in Grand Hyatt for the second time now. It is expensive but very pleasant experience. Location is perfect, close to subway station if needed, walk to local taverns on one site or a lot of shopping in varieties of shops on the other side, walk to Starbucks. Staff is extremely friendly and helpful. I loved breakfast buffet at French kitchen. Not much not to like. I was in Peninsula and Conrad before as well and they are all great hotels where you really cannot go wrong. I like the locyof Grand Hyatt the best.

Competition in Tokyo in the hotel is ramping up. Many new hotels open. The Grand Hyatt is not the newest, but “all things considered” , it is still the best. Why ? - all rooms have interesting views and great bathrooms- best location next to Roppongi (party area) and Azabujuban (traditional). That is its biggest feature - central location to most places in Tokyo with very good subway connections- great club floor (if you have acccess)- exellent “SPA” and by that I mean “o-furo” like Japanese traditional bath - finally the staff is very helpful.

With its location being the best it gives that advanatage of after work stoll. Lots of good place to shop and eat would surely return back.. The Oak Door restaurant and bar have the most sincere, bilingual caring staff of any luxury hotel in Tokyo. And they make great drinks. Anyone who lives in Tokyo knows the Oak Door Bar is the place for mature and adult relaxation

This was a nice find for us (two parents, two adult children). Though we checked in late, they accommodated our request for a room change from king bed to two queen beds for the adult sons. Rooms are modern, stylish and comfortable. I liked the Japanese tea set, nice touch. Good neighborhood with local food as well as upscale restaurants and shops all around. Pleasant view from the room. Would try to stay here again.

In many ways my headline says it all. I like this Hotel a lot. The rooms are clean and spacious and I particularly like the showers.Food in all restaurants is very good. Possibly the China Room is the one restaurant which is not quite top standard. The common areas on the ground floor are a little short of seating but this is all part of the modern clean lines look. One disappointment for me is that very small caterwauling babies are allowed in the Club (business) lounge in the evening. Not ideal. The staff are superb. Wonderful attention to detail without suffocation or insincerity. I vote this the best in Tokyo for events and business meetings. It is pricey as many reviews have said but then again Tokyo is very pricey across the board.

very good experience staying at Grand Hyatt in Tokyo. the personel is very friendly and is always ready to help. the room is big and in good conditions. Only the Price is pretty high so Price/Quality maybe not the highest in Tokyo.

The hotel is excellent - the staff are welcoming and the location is great. Well worth your stay, if you can afford it.The breakfast is good if rather European-centric, and the rooms are a delight. I'd stay again, if I ever win the lottery.

Although it is expensive, this is a magnificent property. Large rooms, well appointed and very modern. Well worth the price. We stayed on the concierge floor which we really enjoyed. The hotel is located in a great high end neighborhood with great shopping. It is also on a main subway line which gave us east access to many of the sights we wanted to visit while in Tokyo. The staff is truly there to help. They were always there when we needed them. They sincerely are there to make the most of your stay. We unfortunately were only able to stay for three days. Next time it will be at least for a week.

Japan is expensive by Western standards but the rate was reasonable. The room was well appointed and very comfortable and everything worked perfectly. The level of service was outstanding and the spa fantastic.

This is my second visit to Tokyo and I think this hotel has a great, peaceful location. It's easy to get to everything from here and I was visiting for business and appreciated the blackout curtains and quiet rooms, comfy bed, spacious bathroom and tub plus almomst a walk in closet. The breakfast on the 2nd floor at the French Kitchen is great esp the buffet. The 6th floor has tons of beautiful restaurants and we enjoyed a drink at Oak Door and sushi spot w/outdoor patio. I'm with 8 people and one person upgraded to be on a top floor w/a great view of the city so do that if you can. The pool/hot tub is gorgeous and open at 5am plus there is a nice gym.

World Class Hotel. Highly recommend that you add the club room facility to your stay. It is truly worthwhile. Great breakfast and canapes and drinks in the evening. Great place to relax. The hotel staff could not be more friendly and helpful. They made this part our our around the world trip truly memorable. Great location in Roppongi.

We recently stayed for 4 nights in a king bedroom on L12 with excellent views. The hotel is in a great location adjacent to the Roppongi subway station and surrounding shopping complex. The rooms are of a good size and well furnished, including the local standard for bathroom facilities. The gym is also well appointed. Each day we enjoyed an excellent buffet breakfast. Throughout the hotel all staff were super friendly and efficient. In particular we want to mention Masaaki Kitano (asst Front Office Manager) and Atsuko Ichimura (Team Leader Concierge) for their extra efforts in making our stay so enjoyable.

Spent 5 nights here and it was a beautiful hotel. The rooms were impeccable and the staff was very helpful. I had a problem with my TV and they were up fixing it within minutes. The breakfast buffet was so yummy, I looked forward to breakfast each morning. The area outside the hotel had lots of restaurants and shopping, it was very safe to walk around at night. The gym was the awesome, everything you need in a gym.

The Grand Hyatt in Tokyo is well located in the Roppongi area with quick access to many attractions and restaurants. It is next door to a large shopping center, the Mori Museum and the Tokyo Sky Deck with amazing views of the city. The hotel has impeccable service with special call out to the concierges who go above and beyond. Rooms are very practical and well-designed offering a quiet and comfortable rest/sleep environment. The hotel has multiple top quality restaurants and a good gym and nice pool. I would recommend and we’ll come back for additional stays.

I stayed in a suite and was very Japanese modern style, warm light, woody all round, good size but not awful big. Sometimes, you feel good size is better than huge. When the room is too big, you hardly sleep well. Believe me.The mattress, pillow and bed linen are excellent, comfortable, firm and soft. Amentities are great quality.Comfortable and practical layout of the room. Impressive quality, neat and tidy. Professional and very friendly service, I had no problem to speak English with the staff.Breakfast is great too.

The Grand Hyatt at Roppongi Hills is directly connected to a shopping arcade and the Roppongi Hills station. It's a short ride (JPY170) to the Ginza Station for those who want a wider range of shops and restaurants.The Grand Club provides an excellent breakfast spread until 10:30. There is a choice of Western and Japanese food. The Japanese food is recommended. One also gets a wide selection of fruits, including mangoes and persimmons when we stayed in September. There are several in-house restaurants worth trying - Shunbou, Oak Room and Keyakizaka (subject of separate reviews).As always in Japan and in a hotel of this class, the service is excellent. Though more for business travellers than tourists, this hotel is highly to be recommended.

This was my first visit to Tokyo, and this hotel is in my top 5 favorite hotels I have ever stayed at! Firstly the staff of the ihotel are SO kind it’s unbelievable, I do understand it’s most of the Japanese culture but still! Also the area is perfect, it’s close to everything and roppongi itself is a great area it’s self for food and walking around. The rooms are so advanced with buttons everywhere, black out curtains made me realize I need them in my own house, and the shower and bed are phenomenal! The pillow was actually great and that’s always a big concern for me. And lastly the hotel breakfast is THE BEST. From Japanese to pancakes and eggs and an array of cut meats and pastries, I’m drooling just thinking about it. MUST STAY HERE! X

Smooth and fast check in, no worries about early check in, tranquil room and area. Great shopping close and secret Dinner Locations. It is an ideal Spot to do Business, Shopping and Entertainment. Extensive both worth.

If you can stay on the Club Floor Staff and service amazing The Oak Door bar/restaurant is great and for a big night out Maduro is perfectGreat location, great rooms, fantastic restaurants, cannot fault this hotel

I had a quite lengthy eleven night stay at the Grand Hyatt, a hotel I have been to many times, in September 2018 (room 702). The location of the hotel is a major draw, in the heart of the Roppongi Hills complex. This is bang on top of a handy subway station, which is four stops direct to the Ginza on the Hibaya line, just a nine minute train journey compared to half an hour or more by taxi. You can access the large and swish shopping mall in Roppongi Hills direct from the hotel without leaving the complex, which is convenient if you either want to get some cash (ATMs are by the Starbucks) or simply want to buy something essential, such as pastries from the Atelier Robuchon.The hotel is modern with particularly well designed rooms with plenty of drawers and amenities, and with power sockets at desk level. The beds are extremely comfortable, with high quality linen, and the shower in the room was excellent. This room gave access to the tenth floor lounge, which offers breakfast and drinks all day, as well as early evening snacks and cocktails, including Louis Roederer champagne. On a very clear day you can see Mount Fuji in the far, far distance. There is a large swimming pool and well equipped gym on the fifth floor.The staff here are terrific, with excellent English spoken. There are no less than nine top notch concierge staff who can be relied on to sort out all your restaurant reservations and provide handy customised maps to help you navigate Tokyo’s complex street numbering system to find your destination. General manager Christine does not hide in her office but can be seen mingling with the guests and checking up on the smooth service operation. Usually on a long hotel stay you will find some little issues, but not here. The place runs like a Swiss watch.

This was a great hotel with classic service and fantastic food. I booked a standard room Amex FHR for this hotel but wasn't upgraded. Check-in was pleasant and fine.Food at this hotel was great. The breakfast each morning was a standout. The freshly carved ham was amazing and a great way to start each morning - amongst the other items they had available. Room service was also great. Had two late night meals brought to me and each would have tbolbeen great had they been served at a nice restaurant. The steak sandwich was fantastic, with garlic bread and tender steak sliced correctly against the grain. The bolognese was also top notch - sauce had depth of flavor most restaurant struggle with. Hotel was also perfectly centrally located in Tokyo. Tokyo being such a sprawling city finding somewhere placed a priority for me. I didn't want to have to travel an hour when I had somewhere to go. This hotel solved that. Getting to Shinjuku and Tsukiji (opposite directions) was equally quick and un-problematic. The doormen were also quite helpful with taxis and directions. I don't use conceriege services too much, but in this case they were quite helpful. They helped me with an advance sushi booking at Masuda (which was fantastic), and also helped me plan a special eel restaurant. The room itself was a bit small but had several positives. For one, the bed was HUGE. Largest bed I've ever slept in - it was probably over seven feet wide, i.e. it was wider than long (though you could make argument it made room smaller). The bathroom was gorgeous and decently sized. I was disappointed with the view from my room that looked directly into an office building. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Excellent Conceirge team, friendly porters, and Spa team too. There was a large business conference held during our family vacation stay there, but we were not much inconvenienced. Kudos to the management!We enjoyed our twin Deluxe Room on the tenth floor which provided sufficient space for us to relax and move around easily. We loved the well thought out tenth floor spacious Club Lounge, which gave us a home away from home experience. The breakfast and dinners there were adequate, if you wish to relax and not have to mingle with many other guests in the other hotel F&B outlets. The best part was the friendly Club Lounge team - personal and most hospitable. The Spa was very much appreciated but I struggled to remember the process for locking and unlocking the locker in the Spa - it would be most helpful if a simple set of guidelines could be displayed for easy reference.

The Grand Hyatt Roppongi is my place to stay in every visit to Tokyo - the hotel and staff are excellent and the area is great for walking. Lots of good restaurants and cafes in the area. The cake shop at the lobby level next to the restaurant is difficult to stay away from - so many decadent sweets and cakes.

We decided to do a short 1 week trip to Tokyo after having to cancel a long 3 week holiday in Japan due to illness. Arrived late on Sunday night and met by the pre-arranged hotel limo driver. It's a long drive from Narita but a pleasant one. We checked in at the Club reservation desk and knew straight away that this was going to be a great holiday. The Club facilities are fantastic and we used them each day and got to know the staff who were so helpfull especially when it came to recommending places to go and see. They gave us recommendations in the morning and we gave them reviews/updates in the evening. The service from all areas in the hotel was 5 star during our stay. Could not fault it at all and we celebrated in the Shunbou restaurant on our last night. Fantastic meal and yet again great service from all the staff especially from in the kitchen. The hotel limo took us back to Narita on Saturday and we decided on the way that we just had to return and that will be for Xmas in 2019.The Hyatt does it again, magnificently.

I am traveling my kid. Hyatt has the perfect facilities and location for a family with toddler. They could provide most of baby necessary stuff for you up on your request. The small park with playground is located only across the street.

What a great night at Maduro Bar, oh man, the band can swing!! We went just to have a couple of beers but we stayed much longer than expected. Great service and even greater live music from local musicians.

I stayed at Grand Hyatt for around a week during a business visit. It's around 30-40 minutes from Haneda airport and is located in Roppongi. The location is very convenient and if you don't have luggage there is a train station nearby. You can also take the limousine bus from airport. Taxi fare from Haneda airport is around 60-70 USD. The rooms are modern and have all necessary amenities. You have both shower & bath options. The service is quite good. I did not had breakfast but used room service and food was good. I also used the gym and although it's not very big has all the machines. I did not used the pool but it's of decent size and there is a Japanese bath.Only feedback is that I sent an email requesting early check in and nobody responded to that. I also did not get the room early but the hotel provided access to bath and shower. Ideally even if early check in is not possible management should have responded.There are plenty of eating options and bars nearby so would recommend to explore the area.Overall a good stay.

We were invited to lunch at the Grand Hyatt Japanese restaurant. The food and the service were exceptional. The restaurant itself was a light filled, calm and most enjoyable place to,sit. I can highly recommend the set meals which cater for any gluten intolerance.

Lovely hotel in the middle of Roppongi.There is really nothing negative you could say about the hotel. The staff were helpful and there are lots of activities around the area.Would definitely consider staying here again.

Staff is super friendly and the quality of service is outstanding. You will be greeted with a smile by everyone from the bell staff to the concierge and housekeeping. Rooms are nice, modern and quite large for Tokyo. The location, connected to the Roppongi Hills shopping mall and the Metro stop can't be beat. It's a close walk to the nightlife of Roppongi, but it's a few blocks down the hill so the noise and traffic don't impact the tranquility of the hotel.

It's been awhile since my last stay here and I was glad to be back. Only stayed for 1 night and wish that I could've stayed longer. The room is exactly how I remembered it: clean, comfortable and has everything you need. Check in and check out was a breeze. Service was great as usual. I did want to dine in at The Oak Door however it was quite full so I decided to skip it. Hopefully I can try it next time.

I am a Hyatt member so I try to stay at Hyatt property when traveling whenever possible. This hotel is one of the best Hyatt hotels I've stayed. The standard room size was spacious enough in Japanese standard. Also, I like their bathroom - modern toilet + nice and spacious shower room. I also didn't hear any noises at night. I don't know if it has great sound insulation or simply no other guests but I enjoyed quality sleep for sure :)

Overall is just what you can expect from The Grand Hyatt brand. I got disappointed on the last day at the Grand Club service after my severa-days stay. The staff should inform all the rule when they proceed the check out if they are not allow the guest to use the space and service. Perhaps Tokyo policy and Bangkok policy is a different hositality standard

I came here with my husband for our 11 year anniversary. We go to Tokyo about every year for the past 10 years and I wish I had knew about this hotel sooner. It was conventionally located next to the Roppongi Hills mall. There are a ton of restaurants within walking distance and you are smack dab in the middle of the bar district. It was perfect. With all that being said the hotel itself is just what you would expect with a 4+ hotel. Even if my toddler boys had came along, I knew this hotel would be suitable for them too. The spa was top notch, and my biggest evaluation is always the breakfast buffet. It was beautifully setup and there was a wide variety of food everyday. The open kitchen made it feel very homey with the interior design making you feel like your at an upscale place. (it was on point ) The room wasn't big like other Hyatts in Tokyo, but the modern up to date decor made up for it. It was just my husband and I, so we didn't mind at all. We were just there to getaway. I would recommend this to anyone, business travelers, families, or romantic getaways. Oh BTW... There was the most beautiful Jazz bar connected to this hotel - I forget the name, ask the concierge. It was breath taking when you walk in, I mean I had only seen places like this in the movies. You must go, if you visit this hotel. They had a live band playing the night we stumbled upon this magical place.This is my check list:Convenient store within walking distance - YesBreakfast Buffet had a variety of food - YesSpa was clean and modern - YesShopping district within walking distance - YesBar / Cafes withing walking distance - Yes

I had an excellent experience staying at this property. From being able to check-in from the airport, to the in-room espresso machine, to the immaculately clean room, to the attentive and courteous staff, I cannot praise the Grant Hyatt Tokyo enough.

Great customer service and I was always treated as an important guest to them. Room is big and comfortable. I was there for business and my office is just above the hotel which makes it extremely convenience. Staff are polite and I believe its part of their culture. In addition, the concierge is very helpful. I bought few pack of grapes to bring back for my family and I have checked with the concierge if there is any boxes so I can easily bring it to the plane. The staff has been very helpful and try to find the best way for me to pack my fruits. It's really an extra service which make my stay even more great. Thanks to the team and I will definitely be back.

Love love love this hotel. It is attached to a shopping mall with variety of restaurants and bars, and the amenities are excellent. The spa is one, if not the best Ive ever been at. All the staff speaks excellent English and super personable and helpful. The breakfast chef should receive an award.

This is an excellent hotel — beautiful, clean, welcoming and outstanding service that exceeded my expectations (and mine are high considering how much I travel). The staff rushed to help at every opportunity, and I was pleased that many spoke English since I do not speak Japanese. I highly recommend this hotel. I wish all of my hotel experiences could be this wonderful.

Excellent Grand Hyatt in excellent location. Very nice views of Tokyo from rooms, Terrific and attentive staff. One of the best concierge staffs as well (especially Ms.Kay) - very helpful. Many options for dining and entertainment. Also, exceptional pool and ok workout area.

Very strategic location, excellent service by everyone including the restaurant. Good food, hotel is clean. Good location, attached to a mall and train station yet it is quiet and peaceful. Better to take room with breakfast, they are good and fast in serving.

This is an outstanding hotel -- very zen a quiet in the middle of the bustling city. The spa and pool are simply wonderful and the staff was professional and courteous. The rooms are very quiet and spacious. I would definitely stay here again.

Check in was seamless, the room very Japanese but straightforward and not just a square box. Everything was quality and nothing was too much to ask. There were more (unused) sundries in the room than I could ever need - everything was thought of. Bath and shower choice, plenty of space and tranquility - perfect.

Thought I was staying at a five star property with properly English spoken staff but The Grand Hyatt Staff totally misguided to a drug store nearby that only sold supplements. And even worse the drug store staff do not understand what is high blood pressure. I have to call back to Grand Hyatt to ask their staff to help me to translate, they asked me to buy a high blood pressure supplements. I took it instead of my western drug, then my high blood pressure actually worsened instead of getting better. Apparently in Yokohama I was taken by Sheraton staff to a doctor in order to get my usual high blood pressure. They have a specific drug store that would provide presciption drug, therefore do not go to the usual drug stores on the street for prescription drugs.The front desk staff also provided the wrong information on how to get to Yokohama from Grand Hyatt, apparently you just need to buy a ticket that can check you through the subway at nakameguro then to another train line. But the staff told me that I have to pay at the adjustment counter at Yokohama station for the different train line.As for the room size it is quite small for globalist member that does not get any upgrade only access to their club! In the morning, you can hear noise from outside occasionally given the small size of their room.

Even though it is a Hyatt, the level of service and hospitality was exceptional throughout the stay. Good room size for Japan with softer beds than many other Asian hotels and cities. Can walk underground to nearby shopping and resturant precincts.

I was supposed to return back to the states but needed a 2-night stay somewhere in Tokyo. Hyatt was able to provide me with a 2-night stay which I really enjoyed. I spent my nights at 1OAK Tokyo so it was very convenient for me to simply walk back home.

Been staying at Grand Hyatt Tokyo for several times and it’s always the personal best.Grand Hyatt Tokyo is thoughtful and caring, makes me feel comfortable.Rooms are clean, Gym’s modern, restaurants are decent. I’ve been Andaz in Tokyo, too, but will be back to GH for the next stay for sure.

A really great hotel that remember its guests. Well located, welcoming, helpful. Rooms are great - quiet and wonderful black out curtains. I will definitely stay again and again. And very close to Hamedani Airport which is v convenient.

This is such a beautiful hotel in Tokyo, possibly my favorite. Very modern, very clean, and very elegant. The rooms were large with good pillows and a large bathroom (with shower and bathtub). The staff were very helpful and very attentive. I also loved that the doors to the rooms do not slam, so the hotel is quiet at nighttime. There are numerous restaurants in the hotel. The Chinese restaurant was outstanding. The breakfast buffet on the 2nd floor was mostly Western food but nice. I would definitely recommend this hotel and I hope I can come back.

Hotel rooms feel like high quality business accommodation, quiet luxury, international style, superbly designed in compact space, with attention to details. Except for mostly japanese language TV Chanel's, this is the finest hotel room I've ever experienced. Room Service FAST, cleaners and nightly turndown, attentive concierge, great valet service... makes this hotel super on my short list of 'will go again' places. Oh, the bakery in lobby is a must treat. Aside from excellent food, the vibe among diners is very interesting - Spot celebrities, see deals being made, watch beautiful international women and trendy fashion, it's a fun place. Connects with large shopping area, subway train, many places to eat - MacDonalds, too!

It is rare that I would give 5 star, but this is a lovely hotel in a very international part of town therefore lacks the traditional Japanese charm. It reminds me of Japan during its “bubble” where everything is first class, right down to the toilet. Having experience in remodeling my place recently I can tell you this place did not cut corners. Nevertheless the hotel has successfully merged Japanese dedication to fine details and service with an international style.The pool and gym is wonderful and the rooms are spacious by Japanese standards and the bathroom is unique and to die for. The view it seems from all of the room is fantastic as I sit here watching the typhoon come into Tokyo. If there was one place in all of Japan where I would want to be inside during record heat and a typhoon, this is the place to be.  Although the ratings don’t allow me to subtract O.5 stars this is not a place if you are on a budget. Even the surrounding restaurants are on the high end of Tokyo prices although there is a Starbucks and MacDonalds near by. Then again, if you have the means... enjoy.

The Grand Hyatt Tokyo provided a large room that most Americans are accustomed to. The location is absolutely fantastic. Located right off a metro station and have a nice retail shopping center below. There is also a Harry's Hedgehog Cafe close by, so if you have little ones with you, make sure you look it up. Overall, it's an expensive hotel, but nothing unusual in the heart of Tokyo.

I booked this hotel through the American Express Fine Hotels & Resorts program and it was well worth the cost. My reservation included a corner room with an excellent view, a $125 hotel voucher and buffet breakfast. Breakfast was great quality with several fresh options, Maduro (jazz lounge) has great drinks and ambiance for a mellow evening, Oak Room is a great place for early evening drinks, and the overall location of the hotel next to shopping and trains is unbeatable.

Well located hotel attached to a big shopping mall with high end stores (Gucci, Prada, etc), restaurants and take away cafes. A few large offices connect to the hotel (Goldman Sachs, Barclays) so many business folks around generally. The service is lovely, so polite and welcoming as most Japanese service is from my experience. Everyone spoke English for the most part and were very accommodating - I arrived at 1030pm and wanted to use the gym so they called to make sure I could still get in since it closes earlier than this but they will let you go in 24hrs if you’re just using the machines. They also have a lap pool and great spa. It’s a huge hotel so rooms can be a bit far from the elevators and the hallways are a bit dark - not sure if it’s just dated and just needs to be refreshed. But everyone is super helpful if you need to get a taxi, find your way to the office or grab a coffee. The shampoos and things in the room are really nice - pull your darkening shades at night since it gets light very early in Tokyo! Showers and bathtub area is huge and they have the fancy Japanese toilets with tons on buttons! Had a great stay here for business but definitely saw a good mix of families as well.

This is a luxury hotel that sits in the middle of a very upscale shopping mall and office development in Roppongi, which is a fancy, hilly part of Tokyo where a lot of embassies and rich people are. It is an 8 to 10 minute walk to the subway, again through an endless mall-office urbanscape that is reminiscent of the part of downtown LA that was redeveloped in the 80's. I had mixed feelings about staying in this somewhat sanitized area but there were still loads of interesting restaurants, stores, etc. if you ventured outside the immediate mall/office complex into greater Roppongi. The hotel itself is very large and self-importantly upscale, with a vast multi-level lobby inhabited by lots of suits and locals going to formal events. Even the pastry shop felt like an elegant and perhaps famous boutique. The hotel overall fit right in with the fancy mall/office surrounding it. For me, the highlight was one of the nicest pool-gym- spa combos I have experienced in a hotel. The pool is large and darkly lit and modern, and the locker room has excellent hot tubs, sauna and massage chairs. The gym is a full scale gym, with a variety of good elliptical and similar machines, all with excellent video screenss, and a good weight selection. It was so good, we made sure to go each day. I think this feature alone may have made this a 5-star hotel. Our room was comfortable and quite large by Tokyo standards, having stayed in a number of different lodgings in the city. By American standards it was probably average for a four or five-star hotel. Very comfortable bed. Everything was electric, modern and refined, with e.g. little motors raising and lowering two types of blinds, or four different sets of lights for the bedroom, all controlled by little panels of buttons. The desk also had a built in stereo with a little bose subwoofer, which was kind of cool but also felt like 1992. My wife's favorite part was the motion-sensing toilet that would raise and lower its lid automatically; the toilet itself discretely hidden behind a door. The bath products were decent but not great with a green tea and cucumber scent. Breakfast was in a pretty setting, with outside seating on a terrace, and the eggs benedict was solid, but of course stupidly expensive. A tip: we found a better egg place in the mall around the corner. Overall I would stay here again if I decided to stay in Roppongi.

have stayed so many times and will continue to do so, location, staff, and access to roppongi hills are unparalled, great spot, love the walk down the street to Tsutaya, like having your own library in the hotel

The hotel is understated elegance with zen style. Great service with fluent English. Room is simple, clean, big and well maintained. Their restaurants are among the best of Tokyo, especially teppanyaki place. Located in roppongi, so it is convenient for nightlife and dining too. Great for business stay.

A really modern and comfortable business hotel. Rooms were huge and it’s right in the heart of the Roppongi hills complex so there are plenty of restaurants, offices and metro stations nearby. Only downside is that it takes some planning to get to the airport if you want to use Narita express.

It was a pleasure to stay at Grand Hyatt Tokyo as a family. The process for the check-in was long specially after travelling from Tokayama which took 8 hours. The Suite was spacious and clean. Friendly staff and really helpful.

The facilities of this hotel does really taking care of all walks of life from working out at the well-equipped gym to a good 30 min swim at the 30m indoor pool; or having a hot sauna bath prior to a massage treatment - they have it all.All hotel rooms and restaurants (except the bar) are non-smoking, but to cater for the smoking guests' needs, a few outdoor area within the building is allowed to smoke. Cigar Lounge at the lobby has a good variety of 'supplies' and are stored in a perfect condition (even better than a lot of cigar shop).The services of the Grand Club is impeccable, a great variety and delicious breakfast buffet and evening canapés. Staffs are all local, so extreme helpful and patience to them is just a standard. Senior staffs speak fluent English. My room size is rather spacious, two queen-sized twin bed, a decent size of bathroom with separated shower with bath and toilet. A good size wardrobe that can store my luggage. Blackout curtain did its job as sun rise very early at 4:00-ish. Sound-proofing was good. Only comment is the mattress is way to firm. Well done.

An excellent all rounded hotel, rooms very clean and functional, very good gym, location also perfect for outside runs, easy access to shops and various tourists areas of TOKYO , staff are best asset very helpful and professional !

We visit Tokyo for a week or so 2-3 times a year and normally stay at Andaz Hyatt, but decided this time to try out Grand Hyatt instead. Located in Roppongi Hills it's really a great location close to the train station, F&B and shopping. Comfortable big rooms, not as luxurious as Andaz but impressive still. Rooms are clean though I do find housekeeping way slower than Andaz. They lose hands down in terms of the view. We stayed for 4 nights and were disappointed to be given a room on the 5th floor with a view of an apartment building across the road. Andaz in comparison has one of the best views of Tokyo. Would we return? Maybe. They win in terms of location. But if you're a first timer to Tokyo I'd highly recommend Andaz.

Hotel was very comfortable, with all amenities (including in-room iron - very important to me!!). Absolutely loved the tub/shower room. Staff were extremely friendly, helpful and gracious. I would not hesitate to come back.

Luxury hotel perfection! Service and facilities were top notch. It is also well located in terms of transportation (subway) and connected to the very high end Roppongi Hills shopping center. We had a room with 2 largish single beds and one twin bed that was brought into the room. The room was spacious and had a wonderful view of Tokyo Tower. The bathroom was separated from the main part of the room with a sliding door. There are clever little storage areas i.e. safe hidden in a desk drawer.

As noted in other reviews I have done of Hyatt properties, a couple of important disclaimers: first, I have Globalist status (55+ nights/year at Hyatts) and have stayed at Hyatts all over the world. As a result, we get lounge access and other perks that you may not, depending on your situation. That being said:- This is a superior hotel. It deserves the Grand moniker. The rooms are generous for Japan, modern, tastefully furnished, and mostly sound proof. The lounge is large, with good food and drink options. You can easily eat a light dinner, especially if you're jet-lagged and not planning on eating a lot at 6:00pm Japan time / 2:00-5:00am US time.- The staff is generally very competent. We needed help with dinner reservations and transit to Mt Fuji, which were addressed very helpfully.- As noted by others, the gym is not quite at the same standard, but we never saw it full. The pool is really a shallow lap pool, but very nicely done.- The location is top notch. The rooms in the front of the building face a major cardiac center, so you'll hear the occasional siren. The rooms on the other side face the Roppongi Hills tower and some have views of the Tokyo tower.Lastly, if you're using Hyatt points, this property is appropriately priced.

Great experience and great location. Very flexible as we arrived alot earlier than expected and got access to the SPA to shower before our business meeting. Service and staff was extremely service minded.

Room is nice, location is nice, staff is nice...everything is just fantastic!It's my first time in Japan and Grand Hyatt Tokyo is the best amongst 3 hotels I stayed.Thanks to the team and of course I will definitely be back!Best regards,Natcha14-17Jun18
